Reviews.Title: “Thanks yall!”
Reviews.Author: D H
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NYC was made even more wonderful thanks to our stay at the Radisson. Starting with the front desk staff who had our room ready when we arrived. Being on the 16th floor gave us a great view of the big city. Throughout our stay, the staff was so helpful in giving us maps of the city/subway and helping with directions. The location of the hotel, made it so easy to get around (also we were two blocks from Macy's and the mall). On the date we left, the staff stored our luggage until we were ready to leave and even helped get a car for our ride back to JFK. A great big thanks from Texas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: Nexthol
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends for a shopping trip and had a great time. Room was of an adequate size for 2 adults in each room and bathroom had what it needed and was clean. It's close to shopping, shows and plenty of eating places. The food in the hotel was ok but cross the road to Speedy's deli for breakfast, it's fantastic with a huge choice of fresh food with simple seating area available or take out. We like to stay in different places but would stay again for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “better choices out there...”
Reviews.Author: RunningGatorDoc
Reviews.Content: In New York City, if you don't give 110%, you will likely not make it. This hotel gave poor service, the rooms were small and sparsely decorated, and the bathrooms small and dingy. Typical assumed items (such as shampoo, conditioner, and a comforter for EACH bed) were not present in the room. The staff made it very difficult to check in - I included both names of our party on the reservation (knowing that the other person would be checking in before myself), yet she was forced to wait in the lobby for 2 hours. As I mentioned in the title, there are too many options out there to risk another bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Broadway shows”
Reviews.Author: Susieq09
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a couple of friends recently.. we had adjoining rooms, which was perfect for "girls out on the town"! The rooms are not large but we did get a room on the 16th floor, which was very quiet.. no street noise. The location of the hotel is great for seeing shows and good restaurants... near the heart of Times Square. The reception staff were excellent.. very helpful and courteous. We needed a later check-out and they were more than happy to accommodate us. We plan to make this an annual event and will book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: tonyw8570
Reviews.Content: Reception Staff were incredibly rude, room was small, noisy, unclean and smelled of cigarettes, we booked an adjoining room for my mother who has recently been ill, then told on arrival that rooms were allocated on a day to day basis and even though we booked & confirmed an adjoining room through central reservations the hotel weren't prepared to give us one. I wouldn't stay here again & wouldn't recommend to anyone else

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert-Jamilia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as recommended by my daughter. Short walk from Penn station. Very clean and comfortable room. Very helpful staff. Great location for Empire State Building, Times Square and the Theatre District. (Used by a lot of airline staff, so got to be pretty good).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: iamskybluepink
Reviews.Content: Centrally located....within walking distance of most things. Friendly and personalble staff....clean and comfortable rooms! BUT check you exit bill. Just a reminder.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajdarrah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in NYC at the Martinique last weekend. I picked this hotel because of the location (nestled in Korea Town, just a 15 minute walk from Times Square) and the low rates. We were not disappointed. I loved the old building and the history the Martinique offered. No complaints about the service at all. The staff was helpful and attentive. The room was fairly cold, and we were surprised that we did not have a minifridge, but that didn't take much away from the experience. Next time we return to New York, there's a good chance we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & convenient hotel near so much.”
Reviews.Author: Sheila N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Martinique twice now for business trips. I appreciated the location (near Herald Square, but a block away from the chaos!) and the accommodations. My rooms were neat, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. I would stay again on business or even on my own dime - I think their rates are very reasonable and they have every thing I would need.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: MRandMRSD2009
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 7 nights between 22nd and 29th of Feb. Our room on the 8th floor was a decent size, clean and had a nice view of the hustle and bustle outside. Room had an iron, hairdryer, coffee maker and an ipod docking station which was handy as you can also charge your iphone through it. However the room did not have a fridge. Houskeeping did a great and would always offer to clean the room with a smile and the hotels front desk staff were very polite and helpful. The hotel has it's own restaurant which we regret not experiencing. It was always packed so must have been a nice place to dine. The location was probably perfect. Macy's is about a 3 minute walk, Empire State 5 minutes, Time Square 10 minutes and Central park is about 25 minutes. Next door there's a pharmacy/convenience store and across the road a currency exchange and a 99cent store which we found useful. So overall nice hotel and great location. If your a light sleeper then the odd police/ambulance siren may wake you up in the middle of the night, but theres always going to be noise in the city that literally never sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel experience - first trip to Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Phil R
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Martinique was a great place to call home for 7 nights. Our non-smoking room with 2 double beds was relatively small, very clean and well appointed (there were no folding luggage racks provided for placing suitcases on, so the desk was used). The beds were comfortable and the bathroom facilities were fine. For anyone wary of bed bug reports, there were no bed bugs in our room!! It was a quiet room on the 11th floor facing the interior of the hotel (not a street view). We ate supper in the Martinique Cafe once, and it was very good. Convenient hotel location with a subway station just outside, a short walk to Madison Square Garden,Penn Station and other subway lines and many familiar landmarks nearby such as the Empire State Building, Times Square, and the Theater District, just a 15 minute walk to the north. The hotel's mid-town location made navigating the city very easy on foot or by subway. The hotel doormen were friendly, and the front desk staff were very professional and welcoming. Complimentary daily newspapers and apples were often available to guests at the main reception desk. Great hotel experience, good hotel security. We would stay here on another trip and recommend this hotel to others. We saw many airline crews staying here throughout the week...a very good endorsement also.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: AlexPuente
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good hotel, nice rooms, helpful staff, what else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice, helpful and professional staffs!”
Reviews.Author: L B
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at the Radisson,but it was my friend's 28th or 29th stay(He is one of the Airlines crews. You can notice a lots of Airlines crews stay here). I got the 7th floor, the room is not huge but cleanliness. The bed is very comfortable. And all the staffs here are nice, helpful and professional. The hotel is close to Macy's, Broadway, Koreatown, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Time Square, etc. And lots of restuarants are located at this area too, so do not worry cannot get good food when you stay here. Beside Penn Station is under the hotel, you can go anywhere from here. Must see the hotel stairs, they are awesome! and, the hotel has it own old mail box :) It was my pleasure to stay here. I will choose Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HHRNORWAY
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Radisson Martinique. The location is excellent for families visiting NYC - whenever you want to go shopping (Macys 2 min away) or sightseeing. We were offered an upgrade to 17th. floor with some more space - and enjoyed it! The restaurant is worth while visiting - not only for breakfast. The staff were very helpful and could provide a good offer for taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A easy stop in the hearth of the city”
Reviews.Author: Fab65Roma_Italy
Reviews.Content: The biggest value of the hotel is the location: close enough to "what to see in NY", the second value is the restaurant. On the other side, the rooms are small and the bathroom even smaller. I stopped twice in this hotel five years ago and few wks ago, well they put a lot of effort in renewing the infrastractures and now it's much better than it was but the room are still the same (in terms of space) and the hall is so tiny that the check in looks like the immagration control at the JFK a long line. Anyway if you can catch a good price and you are not looking for a luxury hotel, this could be a good catch.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: dala68
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Martinique for three nights and was far from impressed. Location is good close to Penn station, MSG and Macys but that is about it when it comes to positive sides of this place. The two rooms I saw were worn and dirty and overall service from both reception and housekeeping was uninterested and frankly bad. One day housekeeping forgot to attend to my room... As a Club Carlsson (their loyalty program) gold member I had higher hopes as Radisson usually grants for better quality but that is not the case with this hotel. I recommend looking elsewhere and if you want to stay in this particular area the Eventi hotel two streets south is a much better pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. In the heart of Koreatown”
Reviews.Author: rcrqtrmile
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there twice now. Rooms are excellent and the staff is always helpful. I am a egular Radisson client and stay at this hotel whenever I am going to a show in the area. Late night snacks and cocktails are excellent, but had to get the wait staff on alerted. Parking is across the street and the hotel gets a slight discount. Close to MSG and all of the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: SureOslo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times before - but this time it was perfect. The hotel had obviously had an upgrade and the standard was very good... Especially good was the welcome to the hotel. We had travelled all day (from Norway) and only one out of three rooms were ready. However, the receptionist organized drinks at the bar and the rooms were ready in a few minutes... The hotel is located perfectly with most of central Manhattan within walking distance. Everything was perfect - but stay away from the concierge at the gift shop...

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Junior119
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. I come for the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show in February and so I am delighted to see the beautiful dogs that walk through the lobby and ride the elevators. I will say our check in Saturday at 5:00pm was inordinately long with only a couple of stations open to handle the crowd, but since we were standing in front of a couple with a championship Pharoh Hound, the time passed quickly as we talked. The hotel is on the list of Historic Hotels and very unique in its elegant French Renassiance style. The rooms are typically New York sized, i.e., tight quarters, but larger than some I've stayed in, clean and comfortably furnished. Our room on the 6th floor was on an inside wing and so was extremely quiet. Housekeeping failed to prepare our room on Monday, which required a call at 5:00pm and follow up to get our beds made, although our request was handled promptly. I like the convenience of a one block walk to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Manhattan Mall, Macys and the Empire State Building are all right there. Since I travel on my stomach, access to decent food is high on my list and this location seems a little bereft in terms of quality restaurants. However, for the first time I had the courage to try Korean barbeque - it was fabuluous. The hotel is located in the heart of the Korean district; we walked up and back 32nd until deciding to try Miss Korea mid block. The number of Asians dining here was encouraging and we followed our server's suggestions to try the short ribs and pork. The dish is prepared at table with many scrumptious side condiments. We also ate both dinner and breakfast in the hotel's Martinique Cafe with excellent results. I was disappointed to discover an Italian restaurant on 31st where I had had fine meals several years in a row was no longer in business. But Speedy's, catty-corner from the hotel, was a happy find. An amazing variety of fresh, buffet-style and short order food was available 24/7 for carry out or eating-in upstairs. The clientele at the Radisson is very cosmopolitan and they cater to a number of airline personnel, so you almost feel you have traveled abroad without leaving the country!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto on the below”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: I think I had the opportunity to meet the gentleman below in the hour I spent in line waiting to check in, so I can attest to what a ridiculous experience it was. I also watched as he was given no sympathy for the hour of his life he waited in line, when the mistake appeared to be their fault and they made no effort to make it right for him. I too was very frustrated at the fact that while there were only 5 or 6 groups of people in line waiting for check in, it took over an HOUR for them to get to us - they didn't seem to be in any hurry to speed things up, and the check in desk definitely wasn't fully staffed. I understand there was a dog show that weekend, but you would think this would be all the more reason to be prepared. That said, the room itself wasn't bad, though the bathroom hadn't been fully cleaned. The next morning, I ended up getting downstairs just before breakfast buffet ended, and they wouldn't let me in. If there was any saving grace, the Belgian waffle I ended up paying for in the Cafe Martinique was the best I've ever had. I usually stay at the Hilton DoubleTree Times Square, but I figured I'd give the Radisson a try as I had some award points. I'm glad that's all I wasted giving them a shot, though I wish I could get my points back. I'll be back to the DoubleTree next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, Smelly and incompettent”
Reviews.Author: Andrew h
Reviews.Content: I waited 45 minutes, no joke, to check-in, the staff were indifferent to the wait of mine and fellow guests. They displayed no sign of adequate training of the hotels processes or even a hint of customer service. I had booked a King size bed, but told they only had single beds left, so much for booking in advance. They did suggest that I could contact the manager directly to see if he could help. A message was left for the manager, but along with the hotels customer care policy, have not heard from him. Our company uses this hotel, but they will be redirected elsewhere. I wonâ€™t start on smell and excrement of dogs, as the hotel has a broad policy of dogs staying in rooms with their ownersâ€¦â€¦..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff, and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: lilaplebee
Reviews.Content: Paid $79 per night (Saturday through Tuesday), an EXCELLENT rate for this location. I used eStandby to request an upgrade to a suite for $25 more per night (came with free breakfast and one free drink per person per day). So for $104 per night, we had a suite (which was HUGE by NYC standards), free breakfast and free drinks. Excellent value! Accomodations were very nice. Very clean hotel. Staff was very professional and courteous. We had a suite on the second penthouse level (18th flr). The room was very spacious with a sofabed and a nook (about the size of a walk in closet) for the coffee machine. Bathroom was tiny, but functional enough. We weren't impressed with the Sleep Number bed, but that's just our preferance. The breakfast buffet, which came with the suite (or is $18.95 per person), was lacking. I would say this was the only downfall of the stay. The food was not very good. if it doesn't come free with your room, don't bother! As for the location of this hotel, it is PERFECT! 10 minute walk to Times Square, short subway ride downtown (Financial District, Chelsea, etc). The subway is literally at the front door to the hotel. There is also plenty of shopping and eating on the same block as the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller987
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the week leading up to New Year's eve. Very convenient for Times Square and environs. Hotel room was a bit on the small side but did just manage to accommodate our family of four. Staff very courteous and helpful to us, and the cafe on the street level was very good.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough of this hotel and its staff. I stayed there in December and the staff there were very nice indeed, and they were super-super-helpful during the EXTREMELY difficult moments (not hotel-related) that I experienced in the first two days in NYC. My room was great and the breakfast was too. I'd recommend it to anyone and I'll definitely be going back there again. Big thankyou to all of you there!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL AND NICE LOCATION ++++++”
Reviews.Author: TranNam
Reviews.Content: Radisson hotel is located in very nice area. Very close to go every places.

Reviews.Title: “Business Receipts thrown away by housecleaning, no accountability”
Reviews.Author: bob_Suruncle2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel. Relatively clean, decent staff, decent location. I've stayed here on business several times, with a relatively decent experience. My last stay, the housecleaning inadvertently disposed of a few hundred dollars of business receipts that I stored on the desk. I brought this to the attention of the staff, as (without receipts) I could end up losing this money personally due to my company's reimbursement policies. After two days of disregarding the issue, upon checkout, the hotel director indicated that there was no proof her staff did anything wrong; she accepted the word of housekeeping, who denied any responsibility in disposing of the receipts. Furthermore, there was no offer of discounting on my current stay, except a promise to send me a letter indicating a discount rate on a future stay. That was over 2 weeks ago, and I have not received anything from the hotel. The management demonstrated zero accountability for the actions of their staff, and even suggested that this was my problem - even though I'm a serial repeat customer. It was, frankly, an appalling experience. I will not give them my business at any discounted rate inthe future.

Reviews.Title: “Very competent staff and pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: deamosandra
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for one week. It was wonderful, a very pleasant atmosphere. The staff was impeccable, everything worked properly.The only inconvenience is the check-in that begins only at 4:00 pm. I arrived at the hotel at 7:00 am after a 10 hour flight, I was extremely tired. The staff did what they could to advance the check-in, which was finally held at 1:00pm. Nevertheless, I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations and Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Patricia E
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times. The old building and beautiful staircase have so much character. The staff is very welcoming and eager to meet their guest's needs. The rooms are clean and cozy. The restaurants offer a wide variety of good food and great service. The location doesn't get any better.

Reviews.Title: “Accomdating Staff”
Reviews.Author: J8825NY
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a two night stay at this hotel and had a very positive experience despite an otherwise difficult trip to New York. When I arrived to the city my plans for the two days were substantially changed. After a long first day I checked-in at the Martinique for the first night of my reservation at 11pm. I knew I would now not be staying the second night and that I would normally be required to provide the hotel with >24hr notice to make a cancellation or expect to be charged. But after explaining my situation to the manager he assisted me in making the cancelation despite the policy. It was a "battle" I wanted to avoid at this late hour and the manager's professionalism left my day on a high note. I would highly recommend the Martinique not only for the staff but also the location and room quality. It's a gem in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: aussielovesaholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights Xmas week with our 18 yr old daughter ! We had a double room ( 2 double beds ) and the room was nice . The bathroom was on the small side and the free wifi was hit and miss but the location trumped everything we looked at . Our daughter was in shopping heaven with Macy's , H&M , Zara , Gap and Forever 21 all within 200 mtrs . Right next door to the entrance to the hotel was a subway entrance .. So easy !!!! This was our first trip to NYC and the Raddison was a perfect choice for our stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: skmccurdy524
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exceptionally clean and the staff was excellent. The location was perfect for a short walk to Times Square, shopping and right at a subway line. This will be my hotel of choice when in NYC from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Ok! Really just average”
Reviews.Author: Brightonandbeyond
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok, not my favourite part of town, busy and noisy all night. Rooms small even for NYC! Stayed here for two nights at the start of the year. Like I said it's ok, you could be anywhere, no soul. V small bathrooms, it's not a destination hotel. Better off else where

Reviews.Title: “Rude dishonest Staff,Do not honour online booking”
Reviews.Author: AfroMohawk
Reviews.Content: It was my wife's birthday so we decided to spend a weekend in NY.Booked online (smoking /decent view) .Tried checking in by 8 .Receptionists ,Veronica was her name ,took about 20 minutes to get us a room .We were told that we have a room with view of the 32'nd street.The room had anything but a view .Called frontdesk to inform/enquire about the same , were rudely dismissed by saying no such room is available i.e. after being fed information about grand view of 32'nd street . Okay.One might make compromise here .After the call ,noticed this card on the table saying the room was non-smoking. Called back .Veronica said , you didn't specify it .It was specified in our reservation itinerary.She said 'If you want a smoking room' come down and get it .Time now is 8:45.So we collected our luggage ,went down again to the front desk.Same Veronica.So I said ,"Hi,we just spoke regarding the room'.I speak to millions of customer everyday was her reply .Not to mention she also did a complete volt-face regarding saying anything about getting us a room with a view ,literally lying on our face.There is a reason why the front desk staff is usually pretty and atleast with a pleasing personality.Veronica was neither.What you can't make in appearence atleast make it in demeanour. Needless to say we were stunned and disappointed.It would have all worked out only if she would have been polite .Requested to speak with a manager which by the way took another 20 minutes to request a cancellation .The fact that people like her are allowed to work at front desk of a upscale hotel no less goes to say how low hospitality industry has stooped to .

Reviews.Title: “Great 2-day stay at the Radisson Martinique”
Reviews.Author: eriweb
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 traveled to NYC for a medical appointment for our son. We chose to stay at the Radisson Martinique on Broadway and are so glad we did. First and foremost I will say that the service people were WONDERFUL! They were very helpful, kind, and quick to help us (especially the bell hops.) The hotel was clean, our room was clean and in good condition, and out nightly rate was VERY reasonable. We were in a great area of the city with access to the subway right outside the hotel door. We also were always able to catch a quick cab, find great little eateries close by, and get great recommendations from the concierge. When we need to return to NYC the Radisson Martinique is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small Beds”
Reviews.Author: winstonazzopardi
Reviews.Content: Checked in for four nights just before Christmas. Great location however the male receptionist who usually works the evenings (the guy with the parting hair) is rude and just not interested to assist anyone. Our room (1721) was a good size however beware, as this has 2 interconnecting doors and you could literally hear everything that's going on. The beds are tiny - both me and my wife are slim but could not fit on the bed. When I asked 'parting hair' to have en extra bed, he quickly brushed me off and said that if I wanted an extra bed we had to pay extra. I politely informed him that I was complaining about the bed and the only solution was to put money towards our problem. Some service eh? Eventually we had no choice but to pay for the extra bed. The hotel has some plus points, clean, great breakfast and friendly staff in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “"Hotel with a disappointing and unfriendly staff dishonesty and bad faith"”
Reviews.Author: walter p
Reviews.Content: Prospecting hotel rooms for years, the Radisson chain is one of the most user-friendly channels. Only the Radisson Martinique in New York is an exception. Receptionists rude and unprofessional. Manager worse (irresponsible and unfriendly). Reservations not respected can not even find room reservation). Collection of overpayment. The official check-in is scheduled for 16h (which is relatively late compared to other hotels), but in addition it is up to 18h or 19h if there is one room. Hosting the most staff of the airlines, they are privileged and may stay longer than 24 hours of booking at the expense of individuals. Rooms very narrow. Fairly limited sanitation. The location near the center of Manhattan is the only good thing (even if correct many hotels located in the center), but the current work next to make the stay even more unbearable. Many friends who made â€‹â€‹me echoes of their misfortune, but I still preferred test. When restoring, fortunately, New York has a wide variety of restaurants open day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Elegante'!!!”
Reviews.Author: gmhalstead
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Martinique was a wonderful experience- from the moment we entered the lobby!! The check-in process was pleasant- no unnecessary questions asked/ time wasted or aggrivation, as with some hotels. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was clean and large. We had received an upgrade due to our status. However, upon pulling the curtain back, our view was of the side of the building. One phone call to the front desk and we were relocated to a more appropriate room- one with a view but not an upgrade. The room was still quite large enough to accomodate us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a theatre weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I shared a room at the Radisson Martinique which is on the corner of 32nd and Broadway. It is basically across the street from Macy's and a short walk to Times Square and theatres. It was a great location. The staff is nice and efficient; rooms are clean and comfy. We felt safe walking to and from the hotel and theatres and restaurants along Braodway. I highly recommend this hotel and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 123pa
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, room was great and very comfortable bed. The rooms are extremely cleaned. Staff is exceptional friendly and efficient. The food is great, would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Fully enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: petitprince2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights during Xmas and we had the good fortune of finding a double room on the top floor without prior reservation. The room did not have a view but that was the only problem. Given NY standards and the price range the rooms are not too small. Ours was incredibly silent, clean, comfortable and the staff was very helpful, the minor hitch was the heating which was not working properly and they fixed it in 3 minutes. I am not sure I would stay at this hotel when it is fully booked as you would not easily get a high floor and staff may be overwhelmed. Whenever you go ask for a high floor, like the 16th, PH1 or PH2. You will sleep like a baby. Another plus is the location: it could not be better placed. 30 seconds from the subway and 1 minute from the Empire State Building and 5th avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Ebreban
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience at this hotel and highly recommend it!!!! I visit NYC often but this was the first time I stayed at this hotel. Rooms are nice, clean and spacious. Employees are so nice and generous with their time, which is rare especially during the busy holiday season. The location is excellent as everything worth seeing in NYC is within walking distance. I seriously will never consider staying anywhere else besides the Radisson Martinique.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: shira-eliora
Reviews.Content: Charming, sophisticated, clean, comfortable, great customer service, subway out the front door, close to retaurants, shopping, entertainment. Everything you want in a New York hotel. Average cost/night b/w $160-$200.

Reviews.Title: “It's the best place in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tarheeldude
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, wonderful----what else can I say about the Radisson Martinique! The front desk staff and bell staff are the BEST in the business. They treat you like you are the most special guest in the hotel----always smiling, friendly, and helpful. In addition, they greet you by your name and go out of their way to make your stay relaxing. The location is convenient to Time's Square, shopping, the subway, and great restaurants. The restaurant and bar in the hotel is also excellent and well-staffed. I certainly will be returning and if you are looking for great accommodations, then the Martinique is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location you will not be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: adewils
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel and a great location withing easy walking to most of the sights in the midtown area. The hotel is right in the shadow of the empire state building and across the street from Macys. Penn street station for the subway links and Madison square garden are only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: johnb2123
Reviews.Content: Very safe, great location, helpful staff. Rooms are comfortable, not overly luxurious, but clean and warm. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “good location , great stay”
Reviews.Author: petervorange
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well located near central park , madison square , all xmast markets , rooms ok no luxe but good level , not so noise at nigth time , there are many tripulation who sleep there . plenty of possibilities to eat around the hotel . when we arrive room wasn't ready and the give us a drink on the bar saloon for wait it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: biker76
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at any hotel and they ask you if you want to sign up for a hotel points card, make sure you do it. I just stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nites using my club carlson points and I didn't have to pay a dime! The hotel is right in the heart of midtown on 32nd and broadway. From the moment you walk in, the staff is very nice, very informative and always willing to lend a helping hand or advice, The room is huge for a hotel in manhattan with complimentary bottled waters, a firm bed and nice clean room and bathroom. When you stay in manhattan and if you love shopping like my fiancee does, you come and drop your bags off in the room and head out again. Macy's and manhattan mall are yards away - and if you have the willingness to walk, take the initiative and walk. We walked all the way to central park east on park ave and all the way north to wall street. In conclusion, a very nice stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “bello, centrale e pulito”
Reviews.Author: paola c
Reviews.Content: hotel centralissimo a midtown, camere accoglienti e pulite, staff gentilissimo

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: LadyTraveller60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in November/December and couldn't have been more pleased with the value for money offered by this hotel. In a city of overpriced hotels, this offered a great location, friendly and accommodating staff and terrific value. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but it's nice!”
Reviews.Author: travelbwj
Reviews.Content: I've been to New York on many occasions, staying at some of the best hotels, and truth be told, some of the worst. I've come to learn over the years that there is so much going on in NYC, that your room really isn't utilized much, but your room should still be nice. The Radisson meets all of my traveling needs (I'm on the road 150+ days a year), but they certainly didn't exceed anything either. The room was clean, the people were friendly enough (minus the bell staff...they seemed so irritated at even being there, but everyone else was nice.) I got there a lot earlier than I had expected, so I tried checking in at the front desk. Naturally there weren't any rooms available, but the attendant was very sweet, checked my bags for me, and even offered me a complimentary upgrade to just a slightly bigger room. Room was available when she said it would be (1:00pm), and I got right in when I came back. The location is perfect...it's near enough to Penn Station for those traveling by train (1 block), right beside a beautiful park at Herald Square, and extremely easy to walk to most of the touristy things you'd want to see. I was quite pleased, and I have some pretty high expectations due to my extensive traveling. I would certainly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: janey060168
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November as a treat booked by my husband who has stayed here twice before on business trips. My husband emailed the hotel a few weeks before our visit to confirm the booking & asked whether he could have the same room as he had had previously.He did not receive a reply so he sent another email again no reply. So he rang the hotel and spoke to someone on reception who confirmed that the booking had been received & not to worry he would receive his confirmation a few days before the travel date. Two days before our travel we had still not received confirmation so my husband rang the Radisson in the uk they gave him the name of the Duty manager to contact as our booking was not shown! My husband again rang new york (more cost) & was told the original booking had not been received and unfortunately the room that we requested was no longer available but they would book us into another room on ph2 floor (18 floor). When we arrived the reception staff were friendly enough they gave us our keys & I cant tell you how disappointed we were with the room, it was clean enough but there were no wardrobe doors on the built in wardrobe which in all my years of staying in hotels has never happened. The shower wasnt very good just a trickle of water. I really wanted to complain but our time in New york was short and I didnt want to put a damper on our trip as after all my husband had booked the holiday as a christmas present for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent sized room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here and liked the location. Located about 2 blocks from Penn Station, down the street from Macy's and near the Empire State Bldg, but seemed just enough away from the chaos of Times Square to be a nice location. Easy walk to Rockefeller Center, Times Square The windows must have great sound proofing - only noise we heard was the ocassional siren - couldn't hear any traffic noise. We had a great view. Room size was decent for NYC - 2 double beds, room for a desk/chair, dresser with flat screen and a chair. Bathroom had nice amenities, plenty of towels and coffee maker. Safe and ironing board included too. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you expect!”
Reviews.Author: LaraZH007
Reviews.Content: We booked this Radisson in NYC as we knew (hopefully) exactly what were going to get, and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is sited at the edge of Herald Square so really handy for Macy's & just off 6th Avenue. It's an easy walk up to 42nd St/Times Sq/Grand Central Station etc. The hotel itself was wonderfully clean and the service was very efficient. The room was spacious and as we weren't at the front, very quiet. A comfy bed, clean linen & towels too. Bathroom was well stocked with products and a coffee machine. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “genuine hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JChanmagno
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff made diligent efforts to allow us an early check-in. That's a tremendous help for us who flew red-eye from coast to coast. She is professional, efficient and cordial. The hotel is of easy access to many venues and locations. Albeit it is situated on a very busy street, the space behind its turn-stile entrance is void of any hustle-bustles. The room is quiet, neat and clean, and the bed comfy. We heartily enjoyed our stay there for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: SkippieNewYork
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is set in one of the most convenient locations in Manhattan! I have been using this hotel many times per year the last couple of years. The staff (most of them still the same since my first time in NY and that will tell you something about a hotel..) is most helpful and welcoming; a very curteous and professional team. It truly feels like coming home when entering the historic lobby after a long flight. Most of the rooms are very spacious compared to other NYC locations and have been refurbished lately with nice new carpet, closets, TV flat screens, wireless internet that works. Nice bathroom with good amenities. And there are always enough towels in the bathroom as in other Radisson properties (have seen different at other chains where one had to beg for towels). An appreciated gesture is the complimentary bottle of water in the room. The hallways are spaceous and looked after and very clean as are the rooms. This hotel is across Macy's department store at Herald Square, adjacent to subway, the Empire State Building and several shops and restaurants. This location can not be beaten! I am looking forward to my next stay in january!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Leif55
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic location in the heart of Manhattan. Close to a lot of both sights and shopping. And with the subway in the basement you can reach easily into the rest. The hotel had friendly staff, wireless internet that worked and good fitness. What more can you ask for?:)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: dori_fish_26
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here in October for one week. You are right around the corner from The Empire State, and times square. Staff are helpful and friendly and that also applies to all New Yorkers. Great people :) couple of bad days of weather so we ate in in the Hotel and the food was really good.. Would stay here again our next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: steve63
Reviews.Content: Not to usual Radisson standard. Hotel is older and although rooms are contempary albeit small the rest of the hotel feels like a guest house that hasn't been well cared for. Carpets and corridors dated. Housekeeping from early morning - vacuuming outside room by 8am on a Sunday morning, banging doors etc. Staff surly on the whole although one porter very pleasant. Reception area and foyer very small. Expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Martinique on Broadway-again! :-)”
Reviews.Author: carol.in.t.o.
Reviews.Content: My husband let me choose the hotel on my first trip to NY ever, this past June. I did not want to skimp and aim for the lowest price because the trip advisor reviews of them could be so negative. I thought the best strategy was a mid-point price and mostly postiive reviews, and a large international chain with a reputation to protect. I selected the Radisson Martinique on Broadway, because it seemed to fit all that criteria, looked like a beautiful hotel, and was pretty much halfway to everything we wanted to do on that trip. My husband is a smoker, so I requested a smoking room: it was great, modern decor, and a view of Broadway. On the 4th floor we were not disturbed by street noise and found the bed very comfortable and the appointments all very satisfactory. We were not expecting a huge room - it's a turn of the 20th century hotel, after all, but the size was adequate for the two of us. The hotel staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. The bellman stored our bags for us that morning so we could explore the city before we checked in, and did the same for us after we checked out as our bus wasn't leaving until that evening. At all times, all staff, concierge, doormen, etc were helpful and made us feel welcome. It concerned me initially that this large hotel was not in any NY travel guides (Fodor's, etc) and mentioned this to the desk, but they did point out they were listed with the Historic Hotels of America and I could see the airlines booked rooms for their air crews - and I would think the airlines would know to treat their crews right! We did not eat at the hotel that trip but I did use the internet and the gym - very nice to have both facilities so handy. The location was unbelievably handy - there were three major subway lines nearby, one right under the hotel, and several bus routes as well. We returned a few weeks ago on October 31st for a five day stay - we were back to see the Halloween parade, 30 Rock and the Upper West side, so once again, the location was perfect. Our 2 dbl smoking room was modern, with nice comfortable beds and pretty much the same as the room on our first stay - but no view! Oh well, I forgot to ask, and will make sure I do next time. Everything we want in a hotel room was there - nice appointments, soft towels, good water pressure, and so on. and this time we had coupons for the breakfast buffet in the hotel cafe. We found the quality very good, with a nice selection of meats, cheeses, baked goods and fresh fruit, and the scrambled eggs were always fresh and fluffy. The service at breakfast was attentive but not intrusive. We were able to check in early, which was nice and once again, the bellman watched our bags for us after we had checked out in the morning so we could wander around for a few more hours before we left in the evening. At all times, everyone was pleasant with us, and made us both feel welcome and like valued guests. We are not high rollers, just ordinary folks who wanted to stay somewhere nice, and we are very much looking forward to staying there again on our next NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good breakafast”
Reviews.Author: Sonia411
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and will be returning for a 3rd time next week. I love the location of this hotel it is great for any one for both work and pleasure. Easy to walk, subway or cab. The rooms are modern in design and if you get a room high up the views are great. You can hear very little sound from outside, and for NY that is great. I have manged to get a good rate and as a returning customer. And if you can get a breakfast voucher, you won't be disappointed. You can also claim points on your EuroBonus card when you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: LongSleeves
Reviews.Content: Reception were slow, hotel was very busy with airline staff. Room was very small for price and the only ones available were right outside the lifts which meant lots of noise from people passing by the door. Good location for the Empire State and Times Square though.

Reviews.Title: “I can highly recommend this fantastically positioned hotel..”
Reviews.Author: erlwoods66
Reviews.Content: Fall in NYC can probably only be matched by spring! The Radisson was the perfect place to stay while my daughter and I made a recent trip to NYC. It could not be better placed for shopping, eating out, sight seeing and walking. However the staff do not rest on their laurels just because the hotel is in such a great spot. Every staff member we encountered were helpful and kind throughout our stay. The bistro is cleverly linked to the hotel lobby and sells Sam Adams on draft - very good news. Our room was immaculate with our own temperature gauge which made our nights very comfortable. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean, spacious”
Reviews.Author: journeyman29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Was upgraded to an executive room on arrival which was a plus. The room was extremely spacious for NYC especially given the central location of the hotel. Bed was very comfortable and very clean all round. Our only issue was, as previously reported, and even in this more spacious room the bathroom is absolutely tiny. Whether it was a reflection of the overall state of repair of the rest of the hotel or not there was also a very unsightly water drip coming from the middle of the ceiling in the corridor outside our room. The nights we were there some of the time was very wet and the staff placed various vessels ranging in ssize froma small bucket to a plastic container the size of a trash can to collect the drip!! Not what one expects from a Radisson (note we were on the top floor thus the drip) Breakfast was not included but after over-spending my selecting the buffet option the first day ($18.95 per person, plus tax, plus tip) we ate a la carte every other day which was tasty, fresh, and reasonable value. Finally, as others have commented, the hotel seems to cater for lots of airline staff so expect the lobby to be bsuy and lots of coaches parked up outside

Reviews.Title: “excellent location on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: ZurichBoston
Reviews.Content: Convenient hotel located right on Broadway and in easy walking distance to time square, the Rockefeller Center and Empire State Building. Nice rooms and excellent customer service by the front desk and the bell boy. Unfortunately we did not have time to visit the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the staff, location, food”
Reviews.Author: tlmittel
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff took care of us with personalized service and professionalism; Cool Bistro food with nice Onion Soup & decadent Macaroni & Cheese & a full bar; Walk to Ayza Wine n Chocolate Bar for late night hang-out; Near Macys & Empire State Bldg, Penn Station etc. We were comfortable in our room which was clean and well maintained, and the concierge services and access to taxis and the subway made getting around easy.

Reviews.Title: “A definite winner”
Reviews.Author: valerieey
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, rooms, and commitment to customer service. Love being able to have a quiet room in the heart of Manhattan. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Sueli A
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel!! Good size of the rooms and clean bathroom. And perfect location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: Just i the middle of Manhattan, from here you can walk to everyting. God and helpfull service at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Liked it,thatÂ´s all”
Reviews.Author: nelson S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located,close to metro station,far only about 50 ft., as well to the Penn Sation,and has got a very friendly staff.I and my wife apreciate too the several facilities around the hotel like restaurants,shops and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, good location to explore Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Dave_O_the_World
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 night at the Radisson on 32nd off Broadway. I had heard about small rooms all over the city and was pleasantly surprised at the good size of the rooms here. It's decent value for the money and there is a subway station right outside the door. It located Midtown so you a have a good base that's walking distance from Times Square and short subway rides to all of Manhattan. The maid service and bellhops were both very good. Also there is free wifi (although very slow) in the rooms and high speed internet access in the buisness center. There are a couple of things that need to be fixed at the property however. Our in room safe was broken and despite asking numerous times to have it fixed it never was. We ended up using the house safety deposit boxes. There is no Mini fridge, which is pretty standard in other hotels and quite useful. So that was disapointing. Lastly, the concierge is actually just the lady working the Gift Shop. Very strange and unprofessional. I asked for a place for Sunday brunch and was sent to a restaurant with a terrible brunch fixed menu. Not sure what's going on there. Overall a very good experience, a couple minor things that could be better. But I was satisfied with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: K80333333
Reviews.Content: Clean, neat, classy. Perfect rooms, reasonable price, highly recommended. Not to mention the history behind the hotel! Oldest running hotel in New York City! Very cool. Amazing location. 1/2 block from Penn Station, very close to Times Square, across the street from Macy's. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Martinique on Broadway - Excellent Hotel in NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: gregb511
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four days in New York City and stayed at the Radisson Martinique on Broadway. The hotel is very good value in a great location (one long block from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden with a subway station virtually right out the door of the hotel. Times Square and the theatre district are one subway stop away. Central Park a few stops uptown. The rooms are standard size for the city and well-appointed with a good bed, television, storage space and bathroom. Everyone who works at this hotel go out of their way to be helpful and answer questions and make the stay pleasant. Housekeeping does a superlative job every day. The hotel has a restaurant / bar which I ate at during a previous stay. There is a Starbucks close and a Duane Reade pharmacy / conveniece store around the corner that sells everything at a reasonable price. The hotel has a business center downstairs with plenty of computers. For me the only negative I can mention to show that this review is totally honest and not all positive is that I found the " complimentary" Internet service to be slow. It was free so I can't gripe too much especially since I could go own to the business center if weren't bing lazy!! Hotels in NYC are not inexpensive but I find this hotel to be an excellent choice because of it's quality and location and price. The staff from check-in to check-out are so gracious and courteous and helpful and that compliments the hotels amenities. The Radisson Martinique is my hotel of choice in NYC and Becco on 46th is my restaurant of choice with excellent food and a similarly great staff. Go see Anything Goes with Sutton Foster and you will ave th time of your life in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great reception, Hotel needs update”
Reviews.Author: linmikga
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is located beautifully for a tourist in NYC. It is 2 blocks from Macy's, a short walk to Penn Station, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, the Empire State Building, a subway station. When we arrived Recption was swamped. They were courteous & efficient and we were in our room in minutes. This is an historic building and the room we had was very small. The bathroom was too small for comfort - you practically had to step over the toilet to close the door. The bed was OK - not the best. Housekeeping was fine. Other than Reception and housekeeping the staff seemed indifferent. We stayed using gift certificates - we would have been very disappointed had we paid rack rates for the room even with the wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “A amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soraia_Felice
Reviews.Content: Radisson Martinique is a perfect hotel, in a very good location. The staff is helpfull, I recomend to someone will visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Nancyd751
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Radisson recently. I found the staff, especially the front desk staff to be professional, friendly and helpful. The doormen and the baggage attendants were pleasant and helpful as well. The check in and out was fast and efficient. Our room, although quite small was extremely clean, quiet, and comfortable. The bathroom too was small but always spotless. Loved the Keurig coffee machine. It made great coffee. Used the computers in the business centre almost daily to send emails home. Never had a problem getting one. The location is absolutely wonderful. We took the train to NYC and were just minutes from Penn Station. We were so close to so many sights and attractions...Empire State Building, Times Square, theatre district, Rockefeller Centre, Madison Square Gardens...all within walking distance. And Macy's just blocks away! Found a fabulous deli just around the corner. Had dinner in a Korean restaurant next to the hotel...great food! Ate once at the restaurant in the hotel and found it to be ok. Would like a more varied menu though. All in all it was a great place to stay. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy New York In A Better Way”
Reviews.Author: Erik M
Reviews.Content: Exstreme friendly staff all over. From the time you arrive you know they're there to provide excellent services. Stayed at Martinique for 4 nights late september 2011. Brillant location - midtown Manhatten - but ALL Manhatten at a reach.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdiane
Reviews.Content: I spent seven nights at the Radisson last month where I gathered with eight of my school friends (without giving our ages, I'll note many of us are now retired). The hotel staff were wonderfully friendly, especially at the front desk. We were give rooms on the Executive Level where there is a large common area with several seating arrangements. That worked out very well for us as a gathering place. No food/drink is served up there -- it's just a place to sit. There is a large screen TV, but that's all. Our rooms were clean, quite comfortable and very quiet. It was nice that the beds are adjustable for firmness. I saw several rooms on the floor and each has a different configuration, but they are all nice. No views, but I am always more interested in a quiet sleep than a view, so for me that was great. The location was terrific. I didn't know NYC now has a Korea Town, and the hotel is right there. We had dinner twice at Korean restaurants and both meals were great. The subway is just steps from the hotel's front door, there is a Chase bank also just steps from the front door, and a drug store around the corner. Of course, you are also near Macy's. There are lots of stores selling costume jewelry in this area and everywhere (and I mean everywhere) we saw stores selling $5 pashminas. Every few blocks we passed a street vendor selling $5 pashminas. Needless to say, we bought some. There is a post office around the corner on 31st Street. On my last day I picked up a self-adhesive priority box and shipped some things home so I didn't have to open the expansion on my suitcase (I like carry-on). A few blocks away is the Bagel Maven. I don't know the address, but it's worth looking up. Good NY bagel. As an ex-NYer, having a good bagel was imperative. Buffet breakfast at the hotel is very good with sausages, bacon, eggs, toast, muffins, cold-cuts, fresh fruit, etc. We had coupons, so I don't know if the menu is the same for people paying for breakfast. We were served on the mezzanine level where it's coupons only. In general, we thought this was a great place to stay. Centrally located, it was easy to get up to Central Park and down to Chinatown. I highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: sharon a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Martinique on Broadway for four nights and enjoyed the experience. We were walking distance to the Empire State Building, Madison Square Gardens, Time Square and the Theatre District. Any other place we wished to go close by was the subways or the Bell Hops were eager to get us a Taxi. There was even a little park outside our hotel to rest after all our shopping at Macy's, JC Penny's and a lot more stores up the streets. The hotel was very nice and all the staff were very hostpitable and eager to help. Always a smile day or night. We seen many airline staff come and go as well. The rooms were nice and clean, beds wonderful, bottled water was provided daily. The business center was also a nice touch to be able to keep in contact with home. Definately would recommend this hotel to family and friends....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Tazz13
Reviews.Content: The big plus of this hotel is the location, most things are within 30 minutes walk from here (although I am a fast walker). The hotel staff were nice and friendly. The hotel is apparently very historic, and this shows with the rooms which were very outdated, the bathroom was extremely cramped. The rooms however were clean. There was free Wi FI internet access which is a good thing. There was nothing particuarly bad about this hotel, it was pleasant enough, but I just do not thing it was worth the price charged.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: TNTraveler131
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right downtown, beautiful, clean, actually quiet. I would recommend it to anyone. I hope to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “â€œOne of our best hotel stays everâ€�”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: We spent seven days at Radisson, and everything was just perfect. Polite staff, a spacious room, perfect location central for everything incl subway access just outside the hotel and a little park in front of the hotel where you can have your breakfast etc. The beds were superb. It is no coincidence that the hotel is the choice of many airlines for their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Michaela_Taylor_
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in August 2011. The hotel is perfectly situated, just a block away from Macy's so not far to carry your shopping ! The staff were all very polite and helpful. The rooms are spacious and modern, free wi-fi, only downside was not having a mini bar, although bottled water was provided daily. We didn't use the bars/restaurants at the hotel as we spent all our time out and about exploring New York !

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Patrickj51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson Martininque for a long weekend September 16th to 20th and enjoyed our stay at the hotel.The room was more than adequate with fresh towels and bed linen daily. The hotel itself is very atmospheric and has retained its character with marble floors and polished wood panels. We found the staff extremely helpful and obliging.Our room overlooked Broadway and the only downside was that the noise of the traffic below could be heard at times,however this didn't interfere with a good nights sleep.We didn't use the bar or restaurant as we spent the days and evenings sightseeing and taking in the sights.The location is good with around a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square and the main location for restaurants and nightlife. Also there is a subway station virtually on the hotel's doorstep for travelling around NY with a direct line to Times Square and the Statten Island Ferry and Battery Park. All in all a great hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Made our NYC trip a success”
Reviews.Author: hladd
Reviews.Content: After spending our first night at the Hotel Pennsylvania, we knew we were in the right area of NYC but definitely in the WRONG hotel. After a quick search, we packed our bags and headed to the Radisson just a block away. The front desk management and staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. They had us setup with a room and even provided a complimentary breakfast coupon while we waited on our room to be cleaned. Ahhh - the room. What a difference it made in our trip to have a room with clean new carpet, sleep number beds, nice tv's with a good selection of channels, soft bath towels, free wireless internet, and a staff that is ready to serve you at all areas of the hotel. The location is perfect if your looking for great subway access, walking distance to Time Square... I would absolutely recommend this hotel and plan on staying there on my next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “historic building!”
Reviews.Author: Pupita53
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 5-night stay at Radisson Martinique in New York. The hotel is on 32nd street (Korea way) near metro station and lots of commercial business. The front desk staff was very kind and helpful, the room on 14th floor was clean and large enough for two people. No frills. No mini-bar. Silent. Good shower. The building is marvelous with mosaic floor , marble stairs and walls... Internet free for guests at the business center. Inconvinience? The hotel propably has agreements with air companies and the hall entrance is 24 hours packed with flight attendents, pilots, co-pilots and suitcases and more suitcases!!!!! Quite often , a huge bus is parked in front of the hotel, picking up or dropping off the air company staff,which makes geting in or getting off the hotel quite complicate! It rained the two last days I was there and to get a cab I had to walk away from the hotel entrance under the rain as there was always a bus on my way! If like being in a crowded area, lots of cars, lights etc... this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: imhenryk1
Reviews.Content: Traveling to NYC for business this was the first time I stayed at this property. The front desk staff went out of their way to make me feel special. The room was clean and ready early. A great location if you are needing Macy's, Penn station, or the fashion district. The beds with their adjustable firmness is a tremendous plus.Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Broadway Hotel - here it is”
Reviews.Author: JimBlandings
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK from a six-night stay in New York City where we based ourselves at the Martinique on Broadway. First impressions? The hotel is sited on the corner of Broadway and West 32nd St (Korea Way). Hence, expect lots of noise, bright lights, crowds and a whole laboratory of New York City smells. Once inside, the hotel is a fairly typical, no-frills, compact city hotel with a large reception area staffed by friendly front desk resources. The hotel concierge who runs the in-house shop is also very welcoming and will assist with a wide range of topics including transport to NYC airports. On every day of our stay, the hotel lobby was packed with incoming / outgoing airline crew - this is not a complaint, rather an observation. If you wish to avoid the jet set, it is best to book elsewhere. We were assigned a bedroom on the 17th Floor - with views of the Empire State Building and in the distance, the Chrysler Building. The room was of reasonable size, neat and cleanly presented and well appointed with fixtures and fittings. The bed was comfortable and the shower was adequate. We experienced no noise from adjacent rooms or any part of the 17th Floor which is a big plus factor. Would we stay here again? Probably not as there are so many other hotels in the city which are worth trying. However, if you want accommodation close to Times Square and Macy's Department Store, you should include the Martinique on your short-list.

Reviews.Title: “Love the front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Seti G
Reviews.Content: Traveling all the time and being a New Yorker I had to be a guest at our local Radisson because my apartment was damaged during hurricane "Irene". The front desk staff are just awesome!They did everything in their power to be helpful in accommodating my needs and wants. Cannot thank them enough for their extra work that went beyond their duty. And I can assure you they were doing that for everyone while making each of us feel special. How do I know ? Because I could hear the other conversations while waiting to be helped.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and safe place to stay, rooms are quite small.”
Reviews.Author: HeidrunH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times in 2010-2011, my last stay was late august during the arrival of Hurricane Irene. The restaurant and bar were kept open the whole time when most everything else in the city was closed down! They closed the elevators for a while and kept guests well informed the whole time. The hotel staff is friendly, everything is cleand and the building is nice. If you are visiting as a tourist interested in shopping you have MacyÂ´s just across the street and many more shops on 34th street and Empire State building just around the corner. The rooms are small and rather basic, the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money. Also restaurant closed by 'scores on the doors' assessment.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret K
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs an update. I e-mailed the H.O. when we got back but they did not even acknowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Prisoners get more space!”
Reviews.Author: Perth_WA_6003
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely tiny. You can't go to the toilet without first edging around the door to close the bathroom door. There is no wardrobe just an open rail in the room. There is very little room around the double bed in the room. I'm sitting here at the moment (room 1032) and think it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, I can't wait to leave. Avoid at all costs if you are claustrophobic. They have portal staff in the lobby whose sole purpose seems to be to get in your way all the time, and even the checkin staff ignore you for the first five minutes when you get to the desk (at least they did me). Overall, a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatNugget
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel in every way. Not especially expensive for NYC and as such very good value. Great location (right next to the subway), clean, safe and quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Not much remarkable to report but surely that's the idea, that your hotel should give you nothing to think about at all?

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st time trip to NY”
Reviews.Author: luv2wine52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location because it's walking distance to lots of locations and Penn Station. It's very charming with a lot of history, it's over 100 years old. My only complaint is because of it's age, the walls are thin so you hear your neighbors. Otherwise I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and if we go to New York another time we will be back”
Reviews.Author: raquel m
Reviews.Content: The room was cleaned every day. The location was perfect because was next to the Empire State building. There were a lot of bars, restaurants and shops like a MacyÂ´'s. The underground is nearest to the hotel and the main station too. People who worked in the hotel were friendly and helped us so much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: pen229
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very accommodating, staff was friendly. Our room was clean, with complimentary coffee and water. We had a sleep number bed, which was a nice, comfortable bonus, especially after walking NYC all day! The only con was that our room was not ready upon check-in. However, the front desk was very apologetic and gave us drink vouchers. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,nice staff”
Reviews.Author: anastasie M
Reviews.Content: this hotel is well placed,the staff is very welcoming and helpfull,the only bad point of this hotel is the fitness center,it is too small and lacking of some equipment,otherwise it's a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bertlassche
Reviews.Content: Location is great for people who want to be in the middle of the action. Empire State and Macy around the corner, Broadway at walking distance (beware July - over 100 F so walking is tough and weather is brutal). Took trip over Brooklyn Bridge at 5 am as heat was bearable than. Personell is wonderful. Got upgraded to top floor, mini suite. Only thing was the elevators were due to restoration and had no airconditioning. Early mornin that means sweating since they stop at almost every floor so before being at breakfast room on is wet wet wet. Hope for people that are staying now the elevators are done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic breakfast, friedly staff”
Reviews.Author: poultrip
Reviews.Content: We were 4 persons and that was OK, but beds are not that big. The hotel has a great location near to 34th Street, Macy and Empire State Building. The entrance to the subway is just outside the door. The room was clean, but it's dark and a little old fashion. Bathroom was big. No refrigerator or microwave. The brakfast was absolutely fantastic. You could get everything! All staff we meet were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: DiFranco11
Reviews.Content: Good midtown location, close to subway stop. But the service was too spotty to make our stay fully enjoyable: - on the first day one of our towels was dirty - we had to explicitly request service to make sure our room got cleaned (we did not get service the first day) - when we got back one day, we found the maid had turned off A/C (on a 40 degree Fahrenheit day) - receiving a package in the mail involved making numerous phone calls to the front desk and waiting in line for a cumulative one hour - the free wifi connection was very poor, even when we upgraded to the fast $13/day wifi, it was not much better - in order to dry your hair you have to keep pressing on a button on the wall - our room had a connecting door, and we were often disturbed by the loud conversations next door. To his credit the hotel manager refunded the cost of the wifi connection. That does not make up for the low average service quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Twigtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location., right next to Madsion Sqaure Garden Easy to get everywhere as it is close to many trains. Easy walking distance up and down Broadway where there is alot of shopping. The room was typical. Comfortable bed, Flat screen TV, desk, clean, etc. Woud have been nice to have a refrigerator in the room as breakfast prices are extortionate in NY. I would stay there again, albeit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “we really enjoyed the stay and surely go back there”
Reviews.Author: edith048
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very suitable for all types of trips - business or pleasure. Its centrally located not far from the empire building. Macys and lots of shops are around. Its also safe for single ladies to walk around late at night. the rooms of the hotel are very clean, the staff friendly, I can really recommend a stay there. I normally stayed at the Pennsylvania, where the rooms are dirty and I had to upgrade all the times to get a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulDet
Reviews.Content: clean, friendly staff & great location, overall i enjoy everything that the Radisson Martinque has to offer - keep up the great work and thank you for making my stay enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Agarrapatas01
Reviews.Content: "We really enjoyed this hotel, clean, great location and good service. From the moment we parked in front of it we were taken care of. The check-in time is 4PM but we got our room at 1PM. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious (we're talking NYC here). All in all we had a great time walking from the hotel to all the major sites and had a wonderful supper in one of the Korean restaurants right next to the hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Subern location but poor service from Front Office”
Reviews.Author: Groundhopper
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel since it is in close proximity to Empire State Building and Times Square, and has a subway just outside the door. Booked a room with two double beds. The room was a bit cramped and felt like it could use a but of new paint on the walls, but the beds were very soft and nice. If you expect service, do not choose this hotel!! I discovered that one of the lightbulps in our room did not work, and went down the next morning to have breakfast and asked if they could send someone up to fix it. The look I got from one of the girls at the front office was memorable, but in the wrong way. Her whole body language was saying "don't come here and expect service", and she answered with pursed lips and a angry voice that she may call housekeeping later in the day... So avoid this hotel at all costs if you expect some kind of service!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent staff”
Reviews.Author: patryciabf
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, we were very well received and attended. For us the highlight was the staff and the rooms are well maintained and clean.Certainly we intend to return to the Radisson Martinique on Broadway 49 West 32nd Street, New York City, NY 10001 and research the other hotels in the chain

Reviews.Title: “A real treat, great location, 5-Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sheherazade70
Reviews.Content: The stellar service began at the *curb* with a smiling doorman despite being inundated with 3 vans of airline crew at once approaching him. The security was professional and unintrusive, and I cannot say enough wonderful things about the front desk staff. Lillianna and Donna, in particular, are extremely welcoming and do anything they can to make a guest feel VIP. I've stayed in 5-Star + properities that could truly learn a thing or two from the staff at The Radisson Martinique. The rooms are spacious for NYC, very clean, with a great size flat screen tv and *fabulous* linens as well as extremely comfortable Sleep Number beds. While this may be a small thing to mention---the complimentary bottle of water and Keurig coffee choices just add that bit of warmth to the stay when so many other hotels will charge $5.00+ for water. The restaurant is convenient with a good selection of choices; the quality is decent and the prices are very fair for NYC. The real star of this hotel is the luxurious bedding and the exceptional front desk staff who really go out of their way to make things lovely for guests. Give them a try---you won't be disappointed. I've stayed there 3x, and each time they continue to wow me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue for a seminar; comfortable room; beautiful historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VTKidsAuthor
Reviews.Content: I went for a 2-Day seminar for business and stayed at the Radisson because it was most convenient for the class, and found the hotel to be an exceptional choice. I've never stayed in NYC before, always living near enough to not need to actually spend money on overnight stays, but I moved 6 hours away from NY now. The room seemed small, but I think by large city standards, it was probably not small at all. Very clean, comfortable. The bed was a Sleep Number, and new. I hadn't expected that. Older historic hotels also have the added advantage of solid walls - no noise leaking through thin sheet rock. Very nice. Highly recommend the Radisson Martinque. Very convenient to the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KarlaLG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Taxis will not cost you more than $10 to get around popular spots in NYC. We paid between $3-$10 to get to many places such as Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Little Italy and to the Staten Island Ferry. The Subway entrance is next door to the hotel if you wish to take it. Although, if you are a group of 3 or more, the cheapest way to go is a Taxi. Subway will cost you $2.50 per person each time you enter a Subway Station. All taxis accept Credit Cards as well. Empire State building is a short walk away. Parking cost for this hotel is $47 per day for valet, or if you wish to save $10, you can self park in the garage across the street. Tell them you are staying at Radisson and they will give you $10 off per day. Make sure you get your Parking Ticket stamped after you pay the discounted amount at Check-Out.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Gnorzo
Reviews.Content: I booked the Radisson following a hint from a friend, and I am very happy I did. Friendly welcome, nice spacious room, free WLAN, 2h late checkout possible with no hassle. I like that type of unobtrusive, but solid quality service. The Metro is just outside the door - not that you would really need transportation, with the Empire State Building, Times Square, Macys and a lot more within walking distance from the hotel. I will stay here the next time, too.

Reviews.Title: “Three years ago everything was fine, now it was still better!”
Reviews.Author: LeoXIV
Reviews.Content: The rooms were o.k. three years ago and in the mean time redecorated! The staff was very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Monica_from_Brazil
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. Near Macy's, Times Square, the subway. The room and the bathroom was small, and the view, not so good. But, it was comfortable, in a safe place, and very clean.
