We didn't have cable TV, but we had a very big king size bed, with remote controls to make it more comfortable, free acess to the (wireless) internet, and free acess to a good business center, 24h, including printing without charges. The staff was ok. Some people were lovely, but others... The restaurant is awsome! And the breakfast, delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: F16hoops
Reviews.Content: As an airline pilot on a long layover, we normally will get a good location. The Radisson Martinique on Broadway is a great location. It is within walking distance of Central Park, World Trade Center and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tsl2m5
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Radisson Martinique while visiting NYC for a friend's wedding. The hotel is perfectly located on Herald Square, which is close to everything but also a little more peaceful than Times Square. The lobby is very nice. The friendly desk staff gave us an upgrade when we checked-in and held our bags for us until the room was ready. The room was impeccable and appeared to have been recently remodeled. The staff was very friendly throughout, from the initial reservation until departure. I'd highly recommend this hotel for business or for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Used to feel that this was a good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: mypoppy20
Reviews.Content: We found that they padded our bill with unreceived services. We requested a roll a way before they gave us a room with a sofa. We never received the roll-a-way and they insisted on billing us, telling us that there 'cameras' noted that the bed was at the door. Disgusting customer service. they do not value their long time customers.

Reviews.Title: “Conveneient location, easy parking, wonderfuly courteous staff, clean and quite rooms. .”
Reviews.Author: Cherilynwj
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival after a moderately long drive I pulled up and immediately the attendant of the Raddisson were available to answer any questions and give directions to the conveniently located parking garage across the street. He also offered to take any bags before going to the parking garage. After parking, I enetered the Radisson and the rest of the staff was also accomadating and friendly. While checking out I observed the staff assisting other guest to their parked cars and assisiting with luggage. This was a very pleasant trip and convenient ,in what could have been total confusion in the middle of a very large city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Dave27UK
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived to the moment I left I had a smile on my face, obviously this wasn't all due the hotel but it certainly helps when you can wander around NYC all day before heading back to relax in a nice hotel before heading out again for dinner! The staff were all pleasant and importantly not in an artificial way, they seemed happy to help and ensure my stay was pleasant. I've stayed in so many Radisson hotels and highly recommend you do the same, excellent hotel chain. David

Reviews.Title: “Experience”
Reviews.Author: sharilynn28
Reviews.Content: This has been the best experience I've had at a hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for you buck”
Reviews.Author: Globallimers
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was the best choice for a weekend getaway in NYC Great location, fantastic staff - extremely friendly and helpful quite affordable while remaining chic and trendy rooms are clean, spacious and the beds are comfortable definitely a must return

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to going back!”
Reviews.Author: LorraineMississauga
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous,professional and always friendly to speak with. The rooms were the quietest I have ever stayed in,you could not hear a thing from the other rooms or even the hallway. Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Happy Here”
Reviews.Author: kabecker
Reviews.Content: I didn't know exactly what to expect here because I was looking for a hotel that was rated 3 stars or more but less than three hundred per night during what appeared to be a very busy weekend in NYC. The hotel was situated about a block from Penn Station, on Broadway near Macy's and in the heart of Korea town. I felt safe there and the location was practically in the middle of everything I did. When I got there, they upgraded me to a room on the concierge level. The room was small (not tiny) but very common in New York. The bed was extremely comfortable and I can't remember the last time I said this, but I did not hear a peep outside in the hallways. Another thing that was fantastic, they give complimentary internet at 256k speed, which is slow but fine for checking email and surfing, or you can pay extra to get super high speed. Regardless, I appreciated free internet. The service was great, the hotel was clean and I don't give hotels the highest rating often, but I didn't have anything bad to say!

Reviews.Title: “Such pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Tildasmum
Reviews.Content: This stay was a last minute one as we were unhappy in the apartment we had originally booked. These guys made up for that upset for sure. Even when I called late on the Tuesday night they were more than helpful. We arrived the following morning with an almost 2 year old. They offered us a free crib and even said they would try and get the room ready early for us. We didn't need an early room- we just gave the guys the luggage to hold and went out for the day. The lady on the desk was so so helpful and the porter was also helpful. All went over and above, they were just so helpful! Having a small child a hotel room may not be suitable but due to this experience I would consider having a twin room or even paying the additional to have an adjoining room. Doesn't a good service make such a difference - the rest of our holiday was great!!! They even booked us a cab for our trip back to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: 34515Chris
Reviews.Content: We travel in to NYC quite often. We enjoy Broadway shows and Great restaurants. We usually stay in the Theater District or on Central Park South. This time we picked The Radisson Martinique. We were Extremely Satisfied with our choice. Herald Square just outside your front door. Subway outside your front door. Very easy to get a Taxi. Walking distance to Theater, if you like. Five minute walk to Union Square Area. We will be sure to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the location.”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateboxUk
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Martinique on Broadway is situated on 32nd Street between Broadway and Fifth Avenue. We arrived early for check in and were told we would have to wait until check in time. When our check in time finally arrived I went back to the desk, after a few minutes of the man tapping away on the keyboard to find our room, he then disappeared for a while to find out if our room had been checked. During this time I also noticed a basket of freshly baked cookies on the counter which you could have, a nice gesture. After waiting a short while longer we were finally given our key cards and directions to the lifts were pointed out, near the entrance of the hotel. There are 2 lifts near the front of the hotel and 2 near the back, unfortunately there was often quite a small wait for these lifts as people always seem to be coming and going in this busy hotel. Our room was on the 9th floor, and we had booked a standard double room. It was surprisingly spacious, I was expecting something quite small, but there was plenty of room for the both of us with our suitcases. On the shelf there was 2 glasses, an ice bucket and a bottle of water waiting for us. The bed was made with nice white clean sheets, and on one side was the desk and chair, on the other a bed side table with an alarm clock with also had an iPod dock on it. The bathroom was small, but had a shower over bath, and the coffee machine was also in here next to the sink! It was a 'pod' coffee machine, but unfortunately there was no tea for us British folk. There was a huge air conditioning unit next to one of the windows blasting out cold air quite noisily, I was really thankful for it though as it was just so humid outside. There were two large windows in the room, we didn't have a view, instead we had a view of the rooms directly opposite. There are a lot of rooms on each floor of the hotel, and there is also vending and ice machines. In the hotel lobby there is a gift shop which also sells sweets and drinks but it was quite expensive. The hotel is situated in a busy neighbourhood, and directly outside the hotel entrance is one of the entrances to the 34 St subway station, incredibly handy as we used the subway to go everywhere. Directly across the road from the hotel was a Speedy's Deli where we had breakfast every day and I highly recommend it, hot food is priced according to the weight of your plate and they do a wide range of food, we also popped into here for snacks and cookies! It's only a short walk from the hotel to the Empire State Building, Times Square and Bryant Park, but as we had subway passes we did just wander down into the subway station. Macy's is only round the corner within easy walking distance. The hotel has a bar and restaurant area, we did go into the bar one night for a couple of drinks and it was nice enough and reasonably priced. The hotel has free Wi-Fi, and faster Wi-Fi at a price. I used the free Wi-Fi on my iPhone and it was fast enough for me, though this was usually at 6am when I was wide awake due to the time difference! There is also a computer room with printers, sometimes the room was busy but the couple of times I popped in (to check in online for our flights home!) I got a computer straight away. After we checked out on our final morning we left our suitcases with the bellman (they are labelled and taken away to a secure room) so we could roam for the city for a final few hours. I highly recommend this hotel in New York, the room was clean, comfortable and spacious and the staff were friendly and helpful especially the bellmen. The location was great, the subway station being right outside of the hotel door was extremely handy and there were plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “bad service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: cosmored100
Reviews.Content: Am in the Martinique now, having arrived off a long flight from London and even longer set of queues in JFK. Was given my room, a little box at the end of a corridor with noisy a/c and thin walls, and a sign saying "Welcome to the RM. You are currently in a non-smoking room. A recovery fee of $200.00 will be charged for smoking in the guest room. If you prefer a smoking room we can try and accommodate upon availability". 14 floors up and 3 very slow lifts so I went to the front desk to see about a room swap. After the clerk went to speak to the manager to check: "we can accommodate you sir, for an extra $20 per night" "I see, is the room any different or better to the one I am in" "no sir, the smoking rooms are just more in demand" Maybe the martinique doesn't like smokers, or maybe tourists, or maybe the day manager was running low on tips... who knows? Being a Carlton Club member I am certain that this is not typical of Radisson service standards, but it's a shame the RM doesn't try to live up to them when it charges over $300 a night. Now that the guests closing their doors outside my room have woken me up, time to go for a stroll outside.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff with a great central location.”
Reviews.Author: shinerj
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at the Radisson on Broadway. As a first time visitor to New York from Australia the staff were always pleasant and very helpful in many ways. Great location and not far from anything the subway was a stones throw away which made it easy getting around. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Andmonte
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel, great location, clean rooms and Nice bathrooms. The beds could be more confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: notgrandma
Reviews.Content: First time at the Radisson and was very pleased. Location was close to everything. Room was very clean. Was surprised with a complementary buffet breakfast which was pretty good. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Check in and check out was a breeze. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service, very unhelpful and a lost property nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: rachel1cook
Reviews.Content: Fist advice do not leave anything in the Radisson Martinique! It seems there un-written rule is if they don't have it in lost property, then you never brought it with you in the first place! It makes insurance claims a nightmare! Clearly the cleaning staff made an error and threw out a set of my $400 dental retainers! and I argued for over 45 minutes just to get them to write a report to say they had been lost, they refused and I was told in a round about way I wasn't telling the truth and that i had even had them with me! Why would I bother making such a fuss when there are much better things I would have loved to have occupied myself with in the Big Apple! Unfortunately this hotel made the Big Apple a Big Let down!! as i was treated appallingly! While having a conversation with the front desk supervisor she continually told me to 'hold on one moment' every time the phone rang or a colleague asked a question about bed setting up! she even walked off at one point clearly not interested! I needed the patient of a saint!! After being passed to 4 people in total who left me standing at reception for 20 minutes I was never offered a apology or even asked if I would like to take a seat while I waited a further 10 minutes for the Hotel Manager which i was then told was in a meetin! I was told to come back later so I rang down to front desk that afternoon to speak to her...and once again very unhelpful offered nothing, even though all I was asking for is a letter/statement for my insurers! she couldn't even give me any reason why she couldn't. After another 10 minutes or so of arguing she said she would call me back before I checked out that day, you can provably guess what I'm about to say!.. I never heard a thing! turns out she had gone home for the day! The lost property situation is bad but made 10 times worse by the awful customer service I recieved. It seems as long as your stay is trouble free they are happy to assist! have a problem- the person you need to speak to is in a meeting or gone home or just useless! BE WARNED!!

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: 98101Seattle
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to NY on business from October 2010, to present. On the last 3 of the 4 trips, my colleagues and I stayed at the Radisson Martinique on Broadway. It's not just that the hotel is first class, I am treated by every staff member that I encounter, like I am first class. The staff at the front desk is top notch, and makes sure that we get the type of rooms that we ask for. From our first stay in December, to our second in March, we were rememberd by the staff, and greeted fondly. The room service is terrific, quick delivery, and high quality meals. I checked in to a clean room, and each day when I returned from the office, it was fully stocked and cleaned again, as if I am just arriving. The concierge in the gift shop is beyond helpful, with great suggestions on tips for getting around the city and sights to see. On top of the great rooms, and the great service, the location can't be beat. It's right on Broadway, with a subway station right out the door. Time square is a short walk away. I am going back in May for a leisure trip, and I will be staying at the Radisson Martinique again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jaxflnbrown
Reviews.Content: We made our hotel arrangements at the very last minute, and we were delighted to be booked at such a wonderful hotel. This hotel was an awesome addition to a great trip to New York. It's close to everything! Macy's, the Empire State Building, and even transportation. The restaurant serves great food too. The sleep number beds were fantastic as well. We enjoyed our stay, and we will be back at the Radisson Martinque. Oops, I almost forgot.....the business center and the gym were second to none as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located to key destinations with comfy, quiet rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jrimmel
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Radisson Hotel and really enjoyed it The location was great and put me in walking distance to all the places I wanted to go and I was amazed by how quiet the rooms were. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: RainbowAlbany
Reviews.Content: Radisson Martinque is the place. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make you feel special. Located close to Madison Square Guardian , Penn Station and Macy's. This is a very secure hotel too .So women if you our alone and on business I recommend this hotel. My husband and I attended a concert so it was and easy walk to the Garden. The rooms are fresh, beds are comfortable. however it's the satff that makes this such a great experience. Very helpful and cheerful!.

Reviews.Title: “Sourrounded by night active night life and shopping area”
Reviews.Author: nrn218
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well furnished and centrally located. Walkable distance to public transport systems, shopping areas and several interesting night clubs. Even though enrance to the hotel is in small lane and always crowded without proper parking / drop off place in front of the hotel, once we get into the rooms, it is comfy. I like coffee making machine in the room. one of the spacious and comfortable rooms in NY city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Choice in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: HoneyNorthampton
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and can't fault it from the minute we arrived. We were greeted by the very friendly, helpful Bell Boy, Ronnie who made us very welcome and gave us any information we required, especially telling us about the very good Irish Bar, Jack Dempsy on the next street. Our room was small but no smaller than expected in New York and had everything we required including coffee facilities, ice machine down the corridor, free wi fi etc etc. Our room was on the fifth floor looking out onto the street and we did not hear any noise through the night. Location could not have been better, very central to everything and a subway right outside, 5 minutes to Empire State and Macey's,15 minutes to Times Square. We will definately choose this hotel as our 1st choice next time we go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “I Love it!”
Reviews.Author: cynthiatsc
Reviews.Content: great hotel with a great location ..... very close to madison square garden and we could definitely walk to time square ...

Reviews.Title: “JUST AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: CHRYSTI6
Reviews.Content: just perfect....great location....made us feel so welcome....rooms were very clean..staff was wonderful...we were right where we wanted to be..the staff esp the maids..were right on top of things when we asked for extra sheets towels etc,..the bellman always greeted us with a smile and gave great directions....and always got us a cab when we needed one....we felt right at home....thank you very much...this was the first time for the girls in new york and they loved it...loved the hotel and the location...it was perfect..

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Judithinnoord
Reviews.Content: Hence the title, it's about the location. It's close to pretty much everyhting or easy within reach by cab. The hotel was fine. Who spends a lot of time in their hotel room when in NYC anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, location, and amenities”
Reviews.Author: California26
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights on a personal holiday. This was my first stay, and I will definitely stay here on future visits. The staff were friendly and helpful from start to finish. The public areas and rooms had been recently refurbished and were just fine. Yes, my room was on the small side, but I don't go to New York to hang around in my hotel room. I especially liked the free wifi internet in the rooms and the Keurig individual coffee maker, along with the usual hair dryer, iron/ironing board, and personal room safe. I also appreciated the hotel security, including showing room keys to get into the lobby entrance, very welcome in this busy city. Yes, there was a lot of street noise. The hotel is located on Broadway across from Macy's and Herald Square. I see people here complaining about street noise and wonder why they would stay at an historic building at such a busy location if that is their concern. This location was great for the numerous bus lines and subway stops right outside the hotel. A Duane Reed drugstore (with basic groceries) and a Chase bank on the same block were very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired, dark, dingy, and far too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: hostie1085
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times with work and every time i stay here i make a mental note to myself never to stay here again! The rooms are tiny, particulary the en-suite where your knees are pressed up against the door when you sit on the toilet. Although the rooms have had a slight make over recently, they are still below standard for the min nightly rate of $250 per night, with old faded carpets, dripping taps, tempremental air conditioning.... The hotel itself is extremely noisy, main culprits being the traffic outside which cant be helped in central Manhattan but aside from the outside noise the house keeping staff are incredibly noisy, slamming doors, bashiong servicing trollies up aginst the walls, and talking to each other from oppostie ends of the hallway, 8/10 times ive stayed here ive had to ask the house keeping staff to keep the noise down as they seem to work through the night here.The walls in the rooms are also very thin so if youre not being kept awake by the outside noise or the house keeping staff then chances are you'll probably be kept up by your neighbours TV. The hotel bar is very dark and dingy and doesnt stay open very late so if you arrive into NY on a late flight and fancy a drink when you get to the hotel chances are you wont get one from the hotel bar, wine list is mediocre as is the food and very much over priced.

Reviews.Title: “always my first choice in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ayo0048
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Radisson Martinique at about 8am Wednesday 26th January, 2011, after a 12-hour overnight flight. It was cold and snowing. l thought I would drop my luggage with the concierge and wander around till check in time, 4pm. I was surprised when the receptionist checked me in immediately, at no extra charge!! On my way out, l was to leave a parcel at the reception desk for a niece to pick up later that day. The Duty Manager accepted to take the parcel and keep it in her office for my niece. Many hotels dont do that! I guess l am glued to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic location, ideal base to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: scb76
Reviews.Content: This being our first trip to New York I was unsure of the best area and hotel to stay, fortunatley we were recommended the Martinique by friends and we were not dissapointed. On arrival we were welcolmed by friendly staff and checked straight in to our room without any problems or delays even though the time was before normal check in time of 4.00pm. (this was a relief as I had booked online direct with the hotel and didnt know what to expect) I really shoud not of worried. The room was basic, but clean and spacious, we stayed in a family room with double sleepnumber beds, on the 14th floor, with a view overlooking Greeley Square, we could here some street noise but hey you are in New York and cab drivers like their horns. This hotel location on the corner of Broadway and 32nd street, turned out to be perfect for our visit, as we walked to the majority of the sights saving alot of money on cab fare, Macys is the closest being only 2 mins walk away with the Empire State Building 5 mins walk, Maddison Square Gardens 10 mins, Times Square and Rockefeller 10-15mins, Central Park and shoppping on 5th avaenue is 20-25 mins, we only had to take 1 cab to take us downtown to Battery Park so we could get the ferry to Statue of Liberty, but we spent the whole day in that area seeing the sights Brooklyn Bridge, Ground Zero and the Financial District etc and actually walked back up Broadway to the hotel (about 4 miles) but we think this was the only way to see New York, and so glad we did walk it. I would recommend breakfast in Cafe Martinique next door, we ate there twice and thought they gave great service, good food and good value, We really enjoyed our stay at the Martinique and would stay again if we ever go back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back, this was home away from home to us”
Reviews.Author: bebele
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay at the Radisson Martinique. We stayed from January 1-7, 2011. The first room we got had 2 double beds, but was a bit small what with 2 teenagers and 2 adults. So the next evening I asked to manager on duty if we could ask for an upgrade. We had a fantastic room on the 18th floor (This hotel has only 19 floors)! Everyone was polite and efficient. Our room was cleaned daily to our satisfaction. We heard nothing from the street noise. This is such a convenient location, we walked everywhere, it's one block away from the Empire State Building, Macy's, JC Penney, 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden, a good 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, etc... I'm very thankful for the speedy reaction from the Manager on duty when my son had an allergy attack from eating chocolate that had peanuts and soy. They phoned the ambulance for me as I was in panic that my son had difficulty breathing. We were provided a discreet exit place so as to not worry other guests. Days after the incident, we would be asked how my son was doing. We felt very much at home here. The free internet with several computers are a big plus for printing out flight tickets and other helpful guides. We have not tried the restaurant as we were out the whole day. On our way back to the airport, with at least 8 luggages and 4 travelers, we were asked by the concierge if we wanted private transportation. In short, we got a white stretch limo for a very reasonable price. Thumbs up! We shall be back hopefully this summer. I can only recommend this hotel. For those negative reviews, I can only say, treat people nice and you get politeness in return. Sometimes , just because we pay for the hotel room, we expect to be Gods. I simply cannot fault this hotel nor the nice people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: shopgirlblonde
Reviews.Content: Wow - so many reviewers raved about this hotel and my experience was just the opposite. From the apathetic and rude desk clerk to the spartan room to the total lack of doorman service (struggling with two bags - who cares! Open the doors yourself!) this place is awful. Yes, the location is convenient - but most hotels in NYC are convenient to subways and train stations and are not SCARY. The best amenities are the phone and the HDTV - that's it. Everything else is down scale and low class - I have stayed at Hampton Inns on the Interstate that are the Ritz-Carlton compared to this. Uncomfortable, small beds, bad lighting, dirty carpet - but the the total lack of customer service was the most apalling part of my (thankfully) one night stay. It is so worth an additional $50 to have comfort, service and security at many other hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Works at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent some time here during the Christmas Holiday break (had to cut the visit short due to incoming snowstorm) and don't know why we stay anywhere else when we come to Manhattan. This was our fourth visit here, and the hotel never lets us down. Check in and Check out was a breeze. Helpful receptionists got us to our room in no time (Thank you, Dalma) and checked out with no hassles. The rooms are a nice size with dial your own comfort level matresses, flat screen tvs and a heating system that works but does not overwhelm. Did not try the restaurant this time but remember that breakfast is excellent, if not hectic during peak times. All of NYC is outside your doorway - cabs are abundant - the subway is just outside the door on the right. And you're in Little Korea, which means that you've got a host of very interesting restaurants (some opened 24 hours) just outside your door. It's a 15-20 minute walk to Times Square and all that Broadway offers. I strongly recommend this hotel for visitors who are looking for a clean, safe, well-located hotel with a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really a great experience !”
Reviews.Author: OTR_99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Martinique with the family for NY/Christmas sightseeing. I was happy with the whole experience. From check-in to departure, I was treated very nicely and well taken care of. The concierge was most informative about nearby breakfast options. (Seriously well informed) and directed us to a great place based on multiple criteria. I would highly recommend this hotel, not only for the location, but for the attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Customer Service and Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Tricia_Naslund
Reviews.Content: This is a historic hotel with excellant customer service. The room was comfortable, the workout room well equipted, and the restaurant served excellant casual food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bruceski2133
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. For years we stayed at another NYC hotel, but this Radisson is , and my co-workers agree, the best hotel we have stayed in. The staff is friendly, the rooms are nice and the food is good and reasonably priced. I have nothing but good things to say about this great place!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are so-so, location great, hotel worth a cheap stay for sure”
Reviews.Author: stillersLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Got a decent rate at the Radisson so from the beginning you know that if you wanted luxury and space, you are not going to get it. On the negatives, the room was very small, hardly room to close the bathroom door. On the positive, clean, great location 1 block from Macy's and midtown and free internet in the hotel business centre. This is a real plus as most hotels charge you through the roof. The restaurant attached to the hotel is nice, sports on tv, not too expensive. Breakfast buffet was ok, not great

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: GraceAlone
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel! Service was excellent. Hotel is located right in the middle of all the action, or the action is just a short walk away! Stayed for 4 nights, over Thanksgiving with my family. We left the hotel every morning for breakfast at a nearby diner. Had dessert in the hotel restaurant one evening, late..... and it was AMAZING ! We did see several groups of airline employees, but they were either coming or going in a group, and it was a non issue. Rooms were nice and very clean. My only complaint with this hotel was that the beds were not very comfortable. They were just ok. Didn't sleep well at all the first night. Pillows were not good. Be sure to ask for better/more pillows before your first night of sleep! We had 2 double beds for 2 adults and 2 teens, and it was a little hard for the 2 adults to sleep on the double bed. Macy's is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. JCPenny's also! Subway is just outside the hotel. Bellman recommended a place for us to eat, and basically it was a smoky bar. We had to leave. Another night, the bellman recommended a Korean restaurant that was right across the street from the hotel, and we had a horrible service experience at the restaurant. We spent 100.00 for a family of 4. When we left the restaurant, we immediately went to McDonalds where my husband ate another meal. So, after two attempts, .....I would say to be cautious of the hotel's restaurant recommendations. A lot of people movement right outside the hotel, so several times the hotel staff would check our room keys (to make sure we were indeed a hotel guest). I would certainly recommend this hotel. Make sure you get adequate beds though! Bring very, very comfortable shoes, because you will be doing a lot of walking! The free internet access was slow, but for a fee you could upgrade to faster speed. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I wish i could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Yasmin39
Reviews.Content: After searching for so many hotels in New York i found this beauty. Everything about this hotel is fab fab fab! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the location is mindblowing, i took my two teenage daughters for their 16th and 18th birthdays and it was the best four days we ever had. The hotel is very clean, there was always somebody to tell us where to go for shopping, sightseeing etc. I am going again next year and this hotel is on top my list to stay!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelvalIreland
Reviews.Content: After many trips to New York I have finally found the ideal hotel. Location could not be better, walking distance to Macy's, Fifth Ave, Rockerfeller Centre etc. Subway outside the main entrance, concierge service excellent. Good size rooms for New York. Good restaurant and bar, excellent breakfast. safe and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Practical, cozy, great service is synonymous of Radisson”
Reviews.Author: cristinatuto
Reviews.Content: I had good experience all times I was in Radisson Martinique, it has a good location, it's cozy and clean, good service at all.

Reviews.Title: “a positive friendly place to stay in new york city”
Reviews.Author: zaremba_10
Reviews.Content: i have been staying at the radisson martinique for many years a few times a year.i have had only positive experiences there.the staff has always been very helpful.the hotel itself is warm and charming. the noise level is noe as in new york there is constant noise esp around times square.i would and do recommend it to anyone that goes to new york!

Reviews.Title: “Start Spreadin' The News...This Is A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: GAYLACP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recently in NYC for the Marathon, so rest and relaxation were key! We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a very friendly desk clerk. We inquired about an upgrade, and they were able to accommodate us. What a fantastic room! We had a sitting area, a desk/chair, a small wet bar (with a Keurig coffee maker, no less) and a Sleep Number bed. Much larger and nicer than many of the rooms I've had before in Manhattan and a much better deal! The lobby staff were always pleasant and were great when we needed help storing our luggage on check-out day. Housekeeping was efficient and thorough. As far as location, this hotel can't be beat. Near the Empire State Building and bordering on Midtown West and K-town, we had the chance to try some great Korean BBQ restaurants with others on the radar for future trips. The 34th Street/Herald Square subway stop is just paces out the hotel's front door, and this is a busy stop which provides easy access to other lines. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay, would absolutely recommend this property to a friend and will check here first on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were so kind!”
Reviews.Author: fgl19
Reviews.Content: Not only was the hotel convenient, but the rooms were in good condition and very clean. The staff did whatever they could to make sure our trip was pleasant as possible. They were very accommodating and tried to help with whatever I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet , comfortable, perfect location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Bavavia
Reviews.Content: Great value, perfect location... quiet although i did hear some talking outside, but it was not at a late or early hour... so did not disturb me. I asked for a quiet room and they put me in a quiet area as i requested. The room was basic, nothing fancy.... i did notice that the bathroom floor did not look really clean.. i saw some debris in the corners.... but the room overall was fine and what i expected..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service saff & location”
Reviews.Author: EuroinCali
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel and its staff! We arrived early morning on a redeye flight from L.A. and manager was super accommodating and granted us early checkin when we arrived from JFK. Rooms were very clean and the location is perfect for walking anywhere in the mid town area.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, Fantastic location! Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MarieB94
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, right in the heart of NYC. Subway access just steps away. Can get anywhere in a hurry, and the hotel provided a great subway map! The staff has been so friendly and helpful. Lady in the convenience/gift shop helped me pick out just the right bag. Best Cobb Salad ever, although the pasta dish I had was disappointing. I'd say resturaunt service/food uneven. Down comforter is delicious! Lovely place. I feel quite pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Initially great ambience and friendly environment, lived up to this throughout stay!”
Reviews.Author: deirdre22
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for 4 of us for girlie weekend. (Shopping, Sightseeing and entertainment). From the moment we arrived we knew we made right decision, the Concierges, Doormen and entire staff were great and ever so facilitating. Everything was practically on our doorstep or easily accessible to. Will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mgoerke
Reviews.Content: I had to make a hotel reservation in the city at the last minute during Fashion Week. The pickings were pretty slim and I had to keep it under a certain dollar amount. I have to admit I was a bit concerned about this hotel as it is pretty small, but I was totally surprised by what I found. Gorgeous period building, with wonderful classic details in the lobby. The doormen were all amazingly friendly and helpful. The room itself was spotless and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. The room was small, but that is to be expected in the city. Great free wifi too!!!! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find!”
Reviews.Author: Casscruise2
Reviews.Content: Great location - easy walk to many sites, the time we were there it was almost impossible to find a reasonably priced hotel - having read some mixed reviews - for the main positive - and with the price being available and reasonable (in comparison to others that were available) we decided to stay here - we weren't disappointed and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, an older style hotel room, not particularly roomy (although I do appreciate that is common for NY) didn't really like the bed but that I think is personal preference. Easy walk to Times Square and Macy's - very safe feeling hotel and area in general - staff for the main were very friendly and efficient but the doormen were super - enormously helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Haroldâ€™s Square, Manhattan - This is a find!!”
Reviews.Author: slrollo
Reviews.Content: For this stay in NYC, we picked the Radisson Martinique on Broadway, which is located in Haroldâ€™s Square (about one block from Macyâ€™s). Excellent location!! There is a Subway stop right outside the hotel. Super convenient to everything either by foot or subway. Also, Penn Station is only a couple of blocks away. We were pleasantly surprised by both the location of the hotel and the hotel itself. Hotel staff was friendly & accommodating. Room was larger than expected, super clean, and had everything we needed to keep us comfortable for our six night stay. By the end of the trip, we felt like we lived there! Free wi-fi is available in your hotel room. There is also a business center thatâ€™s easily accessible with a super fast internet connection and access to a printer. Last year, we stayed in the heart of Times Square which we enjoyed but decided to stay a few blocks away this year. Still in Midtown Manhattan. This location was just easier to get in and out of your hotel. A little less touristy. And still convenient to everything! Highly recommend this hotel and this location and would definitely stay here again! It was such a great find & we could not have been any more pleased!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL MIDTOWN Location! A Great Home Base.”
Reviews.Author: SallyLuu
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter and I stayed here in September of 2010. We arrived quite early, at 11am, and just assumed we would not be able to check in until 4pm. They had a room for us right away which was a nice surprise. The Lobby was a elegant marble flooring with beautiful inlay design. The room was 2 double beds with fantastic views. Much more roomier than I thought. VERY clean and comfortable beds! The location is beautiful. Subway was literally 10 steps outside the front door of hotel. Pleasant surprise to find Hearld Square, a charming green space just in front of the hotel. Tables and chairs and LOTS AND LOTS of beautiful plants. Wonderful place to go sit with morning coffee and newspaper and just enjoy the excitment of 32nd and Broadway. Shopping and restaurants surround this corner and is the perfect home base for a family visiting! Right in the middle of Manhattan and perfect, safe location. We were just thrilled with the hotel, and was quite surprised at the cost, very reasonable for Manhattan. Also, looks like its a home base for different International Airlnes, as there was quite a few Pilots and Stewardesses always in the lobby. Tells you how nice the hotel is. Would FOR SURE recommend this to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Average in every way...”
Reviews.Author: LondonJo2204
Reviews.Content: We travelled to NYC to meet family who were coming in from the UK. We chose to stay at the Radisson as we had gift vouchers from a previous (horrific) experience in a Radisson resort. Our first choice was the Radisson Lexington (better location and nicer than the Martinique) but once we said we were using vouchers, we were told the hotel was fully booked and that we would have to stay at the Martinique. On booking, all that was available was a 'queen' room. My husband called 4 times prior to our departure to ensure that there were notes all over the system that we wanted a 'king' room. Whilst checking in the Radisson rep advised us that we could sign up for a "Radisson points card' at no extra charge which would mean that we would get free early check-in. Meant that our room was ready at 1.00-1.30pm rather than 4pm. We also got our 'king' room. Room was a decent size for NY but was tired and a little dingy looking. Closet space didn't have a door, bathroom was small, carpets were worn and the hotel backs on closely to residential blocks so we kept the curtains drawn whilst we were in the room. Bed was clean and quite comfortable though and although the bathroom was small, it was clean and the shower was powerful. We were on the 11th floor so street noise in the room was not an issue, plus we weren't front facing. To be honest though I always sleep in earplugs in a hotel so couldn't comment on general noise levels in the evening / early hours. Whilst in NY, not many people spend hours in their rooms, other than sleeping, showering and changing so the fact that this hotel was a bit grimy, didn't really spoil our trip. However, I would not recommend this hotel to people who are visiting NYC for the first time or who are looking for a hotel where they can relax in the bar after a day of pavement pounding / after dinner drinks. Bar is small and is the same space where breakfast is served. A bit depressing looking and it felt like we were having a drink in an office cafeteria. The maid service are pretty rude too. On the final morning of our stay, we were waiting for room service (waited 25 minute for somebody to bring us a menu and then another 45 minutes for food that was cold and very average), so we took the 'do not disturb sign from the door'. The maid knocked and was really very rude and aggressive telling us that we should have the sign on the door and trying to reach in to get it from the other side of the door. She had to be told forcefully to back off. It took several minutes to explain that we'd taken the sign from the door in order that our breakfast could be delivered and that we were checking out at 10.30 and she could clean the room then. It's also worth noting that this hotel is on the edge of Korea town. Noisy, busy all hours of the day and pretty stinky (seems rubbish day is a Monday morning so walking home on a Sunday night is pretty nauseating). Really close to the Flatiron and a good location for walking and exploring but in honesty, with all of the choices of hotels in NY you can do a lot better than this. More expensive choice - W Union Square or a similar priced hotel as this try Hotel Kitano at 66 Park Ave at E. 38th street. All in all fine considering that it was free, but in a city where there are an abundance of great hotels, you can find something better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Fault This Hotel - excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MKPMKP
Reviews.Content: Have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone. Don't compare room sizes to hotels in other cities, for NY, this hotel has standard sized rooms. The staff were helpful at all times. Due to room not ready when we arrived at 7.00pm, we got an extended checkout (3.00pm) which made a huge difference for us! Rooms were clean and very quiet - could not hear a thing from the bustling outside world. The hotel's cafe downstairs serves excellent breakfast at great value. Across the road, Speedy's Latte Smoothies were very addictive. Their food was fresh too. Outside the hotel there is an entrance to the subway - one stop to 42nd Street - but it's only a short distance to walk too. Macy's and Manhattan Mall are around the corner. Down the other end, easy walk to Flatiron district and a great food place called Eataly. I would want to stay at this hotel again when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Confused Staff that do not know even their website”
Reviews.Author: Molkentin
Reviews.Content: Arrived after 6pm to meet our son who was waiting since 4pm very tired to find no room available Staff very nice but did not know what room we had booked and that it included breakfast as quoted on line. They told me there was no such thing as Club Level Rooms with 2 doubles with breakfast included but when I returned home found it advertised on line We were given a double small room for 3 adults with breakfast vouchers but we felt very squashed and unhappy The buffet breakfast was just ok We skipped it the last day We will not return This could have been avoided if staff knew their job We could have taken it further but we were tired and thought we will not be in our room a lot It would have been lovely to have the room as booked and not have to argue with staff at reception

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: purplevenus24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Radisson Martinique on Broadway in February 2008. It has an excellent location. The rooms are small (which is normal for NYC hotels, it seems). The beds were strange as they were beds which allow the top and bottom ends to be at different angles to the middle portion. The service was not very good. This hotel had an awesome location. I will stay at one of the other billions of hotels in NYC next time.

Reviews.Title: “So So, at best. Roll of the dice.”
Reviews.Author: pungocatfish
Reviews.Content: Decent location. Ok value. Beds are sleep number, which are nice. Ngatives: food is average, internet service is a total joke, staff is unfriendly at best. A value play in NYC for sure.... Internet if Vietnam is better then in this hotel - impossible to do work... Check in is a mess. At 730 pm they "didn't have my room ready"?? They cater to international airline crews, so maybe that throws off the normal schedules??? And the staff is not very friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Turisti
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my daughter for 6 days with our frequent-flyer points, wasnÂ´t expecting too much, but it turned out to be a fine hotel at a great location for shopping and sightseeing. Everything was clean, the room was spacious with great beds (as seen in the pictures from other reviewers) and good a/c. We were on the 4th floor and some street noise could be detected at night, but it didnÂ´t bother us. Breakfast was adequate, but also tried SpeedyÂ´s across the street for more variety, very nice. We had dinner once at the Martinique, it was delicious. Would love to stay here again. Have to mention the bellmen, they were very helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel with excellant service”
Reviews.Author: Dave14810
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to travel to Manhattan for a medical appointment. The Radisson Martinique was closely situated to a parking garage which was extremely convenient. We were also impressed with the security that the doorman provided by monitoring the door into the lobby. We found the hotel to be clean and the staff to be professional and proficient and willing to assist us when we needed it. Considering what most hotels of this caliber in NYC charge we found the Radisson Martinique to be far more reasonable than others. We certainly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this to anyone who has to travel to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RadHal
Reviews.Content: I have been to NY many times and have stayed in many hotels. This is the best hotel I've stayed in yet. It was a reasonable price with a clean, adequate sized room. It is in an excellent location - walking distance from Penn Station and Times Square. It was QUIET! This is the first hotel I've stayed in where it was so soundproof, you aren't kept up all night from honking and police cars. And the staff was very friendly. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: me2sl
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at The Radison Martinique. I love th location, it is clean all the satff is friendly and very helpful. If you order room service, it is there quick, warm and tasty. definitly a must try

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: misty59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and efficient and caring. Our room was PH2 and it was very nice. The Bell hop service was excellent. We ate a dinner in the Cafe Martinique, as well as a breakfast and it was just fine and the service was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I came into Manhattan...”
Reviews.Author: sholland2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came into Manhattan without really knowing where the ideal place to stay would be. I started looking at hotels on discount websites and originally called the radison Lexington. They were completely booked and recommended the radison martinique. This hotel was beautiful, the service was great and every request we made was accommodated. The hotel is located in "Korea Town" which is very centrally located. There is a subway entrance right outside of the hotel, which is nice for touring the city. The room was literally the size of a small bedroom, but it was perfect for anyone who is not planning on spending a lot of time in their room. I was very impressed what we got for about $200 in Manhattan. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LuisRagd
Reviews.Content: On June I stayed at the Radisson Martinique at Broadway, New York City. The treatment of their employees to help me for a good rest was fantastic. They were really worried to bring a good service everyday, specially Juan, the manager. Thanks Juan and all your staff! I was staying for business for the Puerto Rican Parade and the location of the hotel fullfilled the purpose for the event and to visit other points of interest. The rooms were always clean and confortable. When in New York, consider the Radisson Martinique!

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hakko936
Reviews.Content: We had never been to NYC and decided on this hotel. Check in was at 4PM. I called at 9:30 that morning to see if we could check in around 2PM. They said no problem and they were correct. Check in was a breeze. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Yes, our room was small compared to the normal hotel you stay in on a trip. It was by no means uncomfortably small for me, my wife, and our 19yo son. The room was SPOTLESS and well laid out. There was no noise from inside the hotel. That place is QUIET. The only noise I heard was an occasional faint noise from the street. The location is PERFECT. You are in the middle of everything without being overwhelmed. Times Square, Empire State Building, Manhattan Mall, etc is within easy walking distance. You can take the subway anywhere else you want to go. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We requested an additonal blanket and pillow at about 10PM the first night. It was there with a smile by 10:15. We asked the staff several "tourist" questions and they were always very helpful. If I go back to NY, I will stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kxs45
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms, helpful and pleasant staff, walking distance from Penn Station. Expensive, but maybe not bad for NYC -- I do not travel there much.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: asevier
Reviews.Content: Not only does the Radisson Martinique on Broadway have the perfect location, the customer service and the staff are great! I have stayed at the hotel twice and each time I have received stlellar service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mjc01
Reviews.Content: New York City was great and this hotel was very convenient in terms of walking out the door proximity to public transportation, stores, restaurants. Even at midnight it was well-lit and safe to walk around. Room was clean but average. Doormen were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing adjustable beds”
Reviews.Author: pelladiluna
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here. Staff were way more friendly and helpful than typical New York tourist fare. Also loved the adjustable bed and allergy free room. I left my phone in my room. I phoned them after I had left the city and they went out of their way to get it back to me safely. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like coming home.”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume89
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after an uncomfortable night at another hotel we had booked on-line. It's a bit more expensive, but well worth it. It's a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, most comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jbrett
Reviews.Content: Just come back after staying 3 nights in the Radisson Martinique on Broadway. Had a twin room with 2 windows, one viewing out to the Empire State. The bed and pillows are the most comfortable I ever had in a hotel, they also have a electronic device so you can make the bed as soft or as hard as you like. The bed is more the size of a double than a single. The room was clean and they left complimentary water for you each day. There was also a coffee machine and micorwave in the room. Ideally we would have prefered a fridge to a microwave. The bathroom was clean, reasonable size and had a great shower with clean towels everyday. The location is great and a few steps away from Macys and the Empire State and about a 25 minute walk to Times Square. We walked it sometimes or we got on a little bike to take us there. Taxis were very hard to flag down, its not like the movies. The hotel has a great cafe for breakfast and a nice bar too, it also has free internet in the Business Centre. We had a buffet breakfast everyday which was lovely. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is back!”
Reviews.Author: JeanHK
Reviews.Content: Not only was this location killer - next to Empire State Building and Macys and a short walk to Times Square - the customer service is excellent. We cannot say enough about Ronnie at the door - very courteous and knowledgeable. He was definitely the real deal. Everyone was helpful, though. I loved the security at the front door - asking to check room keys, the front desk was nice, and when we had drainage problems in the tub late at night, someone was on it immediately. The rooms are nice and clean, but small (it is after all, NYC). There was a bit of mildew in the grout in the tub, but not sure what could be done short of taking the grout/chalk off and starting over. Thanks, Radisson, for getting it right!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no WiFi on iPhones!”
Reviews.Author: NMRK
Reviews.Content: Positive: The hotel is very comfortable and it's transformation from Holiday Inn to Radisson is a welcome change. Finally, the rooms are soundproof and they've removed the noisy vending machines in each room. Bed was very comfortable and the coffee maker is great! Negative: For a hotel of this standard, which attracts aircrew and business travellers from all over the world, I would expect to connect via WiFi on my iPhone without any problems, but this is not the case. They offer free (i.e. SLOW) internet & WIFI at 128K or paid for at $12.95 per day at 1.5MB (i.e. a little faster) but it only works on a few devices... and especially NOT ON IPHONES!!! I asked hotel staff about it and they could only apologise... Telephone calls from room phone very expensive!! Thinking it would be cheaper than using my mobile phone, I made a two-minute call to a friend in New Jersey and was charged $7.75!! Rip off!!! Great Location: Macy's is across the road and the Garment District is a 5 minute walk. Times Square is 10 minutes walk!!! Nice!!

Reviews.Title: “very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Kopfkissen
Reviews.Content: I much enjoyed staying at this hotel in an old and impressing building. It gave a real New York feel, being right in the middle of everything. Its not very fancy, but decent and clean, my room had a fair size, was calm, and the bed was very comfortable. What I liked most was breakfast, served in a real New York cafe with large windows going onto the Avenue, and you could watch NY streetlife passing by for ever. Very kind service everwhere in the hotel, for the rates a real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: indiag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location Macy;s, Penn station, Madison Squire garden, Empire state building etc are nearby. The hotel rooms are good but the service is below average. The hotel has changed from one chain to another chain; but the service remains the same.

Reviews.Title: “not so good, but not so bad”
Reviews.Author: phatbear
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked for several reasons: location, its right on top of a subway, closeness to macys, which we spent far too much time in, the brand name and cost. The hotel looks good and the rooms are pretty well laid out, however for 4 people, 2 adults and 2 teens, it was on the small side, but the room was clean and the beds comfy, but not typical king/queen size beds these were standard doubles. Now the negatives and im afraid to say there were a few: The big ones first: On day 2 our bathroom flooded, if I hadnt been there and wasnt able to stop the toilet flooding by messing with the plumbing, the room, along with all our baggage and purchases would have been ruined. The same problem on day 4 with the toilet however this time it didnt over flow it just filled up made the toilet un-usable. The mouldy danish which my good lady had on day 4 in the restaurant, oddly we had been give free breakfasts due to the toilet issues. The waitress who must have double vision, I assume this as every time she served up juice it half ended up on the table. The lack of communication at front desk when asking if our issues had been dealt with. Our passes which stopped working on day 4 so all our passes needed re-activating. The inablity to give us enough towels/flannels and pillows for 4 people. The shower head which wasnt actually attached to the wall. Having to ask for more toilet paper on a few occasions. To be fair most of the issues were dealt with quickly but the problems kept coming. Would we stay again? Probably not we paid a premium to stay with a recognisable brand and yet the above issues would stop us staying there again and it would probably motivate us to warn people about the hotel. No safe in the room

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Dale11566
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, clean and extremely convenient for subway travel around the city. We found the bellmen to be friendly and very helpful. We were on 3rd floor and rest of our family on the 14th. Their rooms seemed a bit larger and they had sleep number beds, so a higher floor may be a good choice. Free internet that is offered is a slower speed. Higher speed is available at a charge. Overall, we were very pleased and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We go back every year!”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherGraham
Reviews.Content: For the past 4 years we've stayed at the Radisson Martinique in Manhattan, where we host two conferences each year. With literally hundreds of hotels to choose from in Manhattan, we continue to hold our conferences at the Radisson Martinique because the staff is fantastic. From the banquet staff to the restaurant to the bell hops and housekeeping, they go out of their way to make us welcome and to ensure ours staff and our guests have everything they need. Thumbs up and 5 stars! We'll be back in November and we're already looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: krodgers0610
Reviews.Content: I was very unhappy with the hotel staff and will never stay there again. First we tried to pay with our corporate card as we own a business and this was not allowed. Therefore had to pay cash. Seven hours later we were called in our room to tell us that they gave us more money back then should have gotten, asked them what proof they had of this since it had been since seven hours since we checked in and we did not count the change we received, they did not have this. Lastely we went to check out of the room and had to sign to get our deposit back and my husband was told he needed to have manager approval because his signature did not exactly match the signature from the check in, no two signatures are exactly alike.. The room was pretty small, the bed was even samller and hard to fit two people. I think it was too expensive for our hassle..would not recomened this to anyone, although the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Bargain”
Reviews.Author: cantravel00
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel fantastically located, but my room was in perfect condition. It appeared newly renovated with excellent furniture. My floor was very quiet. The room was spotless and of an adequate size. In spite of what I read in other reviews, the front desk service was courteous, efficient, and my check-in was a breeze. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Len1000
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about this hotel when I read the reviews on here, but can honestly say it was great. We arrived about 2pm, check in isn't until 4pm but we were able to check our bags in so we could get out and get our bearings. Once we came back about 5pm we were checked in and in our rooms straight away. There are a lot of airline staff there, but they don't check in via the desk so didn't cause any problems. The hotel is in a perfect location, easy walking distance to Empire State, Uptown, Times Square and Macy's. The rooms were good for what you need and for us that was a bed and shower as the rest of the time we were out and about exporing! I would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “If you care about anything other location - don't go”
Reviews.Author: dmmNh
Reviews.Content: What was supposed to be a fun "Mother/Daughter" weekend - turned out to be quite frustrating. When we booked our rooms no two-bed rooms were aviailable. We booked 4 King rooms, each mother/daughter sharing a bed. After months of planning, we arrived at out destination. Knowign it was early, we hoped that one room might be available just to drop off luggage and such. All of the reservations, although booked in each mother's name, came up under one. It took a while, but finally the names for the rooms were corrected - so we thought. We were then advised that we had been 'UPGRADED", well, 2 rooms had only a single full/queen bed. One was a "suite" but still only had a queen bed, another did have a king,. Check-in complete we ventured into the city. upon return, we came back indivually - wll what a surprise when I was in my room and another member of our party had key cars to the same room. A trip to the desk and now really becoming angry - we were given 4 drink coupons - luckly the lounge is opened late, otherwise we wouldn't have been able to use them. We recieved an email that late check out would be free - when I called I was told $95 - another trip to the desk. more frustration. The key cards to the room we given until 5:00 were deactiviated when one of us tried to go back at 3:30. Luckily she had ID in the luggage that matched the ID she had with her, otherwise - we weren't getting back in. Antoher email advised that additional parking was $36. At final check out because we used the valet it was $47 each. more frustration. After completing the survey we were offed a discount on a future stay - no thanks - not planning to go back anytime soon. When I inquired about the parking charge again - I was told we didn't pay enough!!!!! After corresponding unsuccesfully the customer service at the hotel, I asked for a corporate contact. They kindly provided me with a number and advised that I would be directed back to the same person I dealt with at the hotel. 100% Customer Satisfaction- I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Met the most rude receptionist in my life in Radisson Martinique”
Reviews.Author: and
Reviews.Content: We booked room for one night by phone from JFK on 17th April at a cost of $464 plus tax. When we arrived at checkin we gave a blond receptionist (Heather) our name to be told is most grumpy tone that there was no room booked by us. We gave her booking ref. no. and she eventually pushed form in front of my husband to complete, mumbled that she required ID and pointed with index finger straight at me and said "put her name on it too". My husband didn't quite understand her and she again pointed at me & mumbled "put her name on that form". I was so tempted to tell her not to point at me in that fashion. The remainder of the staff are so pleasant I do not quite understand why they tolerate such a rude staff member to be among them and particularly allowing her to deal with guests. Hotel is ok - it is by far overpriced and you can get much better accommodation and service in any of the hotels within 2 min. walk in same area.

Reviews.Title: “Do not bother”
Reviews.Author: StiflerVI
Reviews.Content: I am just back from 4 days in the Radisson Martinique. The staff apparently hates their jobs. Checking in time is a joke. Internet speed is at par with what you would expect in the middle of Sahara etc. Do not be fooled by their offer to buy you a dinner as compensation. What you get is not enough to buy you a starter. Do not even bother trying to complain to them (the Hotel or Radisson), all you get is rude answers.

Reviews.Title: “Airline Cabin crew come first”
Reviews.Author: StanCoyle
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in the Radisson Martinique. Our only problem was checking in - we arrived on time to find we had to wait three hours for our room. After travelling from Belfast we were exhausted and disappointed. The attitude of the staff ranged from rude to very helpful. To be fair we did get a few drinks vouchers for the hotel bar and after complaining again two hours later we got a complimentary breakfast. To be honest I would rather of had my room to rest and freshen up in than anything else. The next day we realised that the hotel has contractual arrangements with at least one airline - they use rooms for as long as they need them - unlike Joe Public who is out at 11. Another thing, the so called free internet sucks! Apart from that the rooms are clean and well looked after and the hotel location is excellent. Good luck checking in - you will need it!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, not spectacular, handy to the south end of midtown”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Callahan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Radisson Martinique twice for business. The price can be decent for the area if you catch it right and dig around a little. The hotel is undergoing some renovation, but none seemed to be in prominent areas. I've had a regular single and was once given one of their jr. exec singles. Obviously the latter was much nicer, larger, better bathroom. The regular single is typical for NYC - very small room. I found the rooms to be clean, serviceable, and the bathrooms to be reasonably up-to-date. The location is solid, if you don't mind being around the corner from the Empire State. It makes that and lower midtown (MSG) highly accessible. Subway stop is literally steps from the front door. Very compact workout room in the basement has several treadmills and steppers, plus a separate room with free weights. Disappointingly, no bikes. It is NOT the exercise room pictured on their website. I have 2 main problems with the Radisson Martinique - 1) check-in is a deathly long process. No idea why, but it's been consistent that way for me and for co-workers. 2) their website advertises "High-speed, wireless Internet access (complimentary)." This is either a flat out lie or intentionally misleading (like maybe it's free in the lobby that way). For a fee, you can get broadband. For free, you can get access at 56k (remember that noisy modem you had 10 years ago? Yeah, it's about that fast). I kid you not. Finally, it's probably worth sharing that my basic single room had the most interesting view I've ever had at a hotel. It seems that neighboring gentleman's club Rick's Cabaret has a rooftop VIP section, and that my room overlooked it from about 10 floors up. I imagine there are laws against rooftop nudity in NYC and no outright nudity was apparent. Still, it's weird, right?

Reviews.Title: “Full Review of Radisson Martinique on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: rankfussa
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 days in this hotel. I paid about $ 250 for 3 people in the same room. I made payment advance, and received vouchers to be presented at the front desk at the time of check-in. I will try to put as much information as possible for everyone. Also took some pictures to illustrate better. Room: The room is not large, it's normal size. They do not have a policy of 3 twin beds. I was upset because I made the reservation (agency travel) for three single beds, which did not exist. The room is ideal for maximum 2 persons. Three or more, will be very tight. Important Notice: Don't have minibar inside the room. On each floor has a machine selling beverages and water, the cost for $ 3 each. Bed: Very comfortable. Excellent. Bed Linen & Quilts very soft. Wonderful. Bathroom: It is also not big, but it is a reasonable size. Egyptian Towels for optimal absorption. Shower it's very good too. It has a hairdryer, cap, free soaps and shampoos. Inside the bathroom, has a coffee machine with 3 sachets of coffee, replenished daily. TV Room: I had difficulties to make it work. has over 15 channels in HDTV, and is 32 inches. Phone Room: 1-800 For phones, they only charge 0.50 cents per call, not per minute. Have public phones in the hotel lobby. Maid: In my room, I didn't locked nothing and nothing missing. In my case, was highly reliable. Always I arrived the room was very well-done, and was not touched in private items. BellBoys: They are very professional and efficient. If you get to the hotel too early for check-in, leave your luggages with them and get off to tour the city until the time of check-in. Your luggages will be safe in an private room, without access for guests. Do not forget give tips for them. For a taxi, you can talk with them too, that they will provide the same time. Safe: Don't have inside the room, just at the front desk. But it is individual. Reception: Many here, write bad reviews of the front desk. But, what you pay, you receive 100%. If you want a plus, something unusual, hardly chances of you get. They do not get a smile on your face for free. I want to mention that everything, what I needed and paid, I received, and nothing more that this. Just that you paid and nothing more. Business Center: It has 7 computers with free Internet in the hotel lobby. Have printer for free too. Are 15 minutes for each guest. But are busy all the time. Just sit, wait, and done. Location: Sensational. Has absolutely everything around the hotel. Stores, Deli's, Fast Food (All Brands), Shopping, and much more. It has an entrance/exit of 34 Herald Square station, 10 meters from the door of the Hotel. Simply amazing that. Times Square: 20 minutes walking. It is only one metro station to came (34th to 42th) It's easy and practical to go to any Times time of day or night. I think was so far, but I was wrong. It is near the hotel. Trust me. I came back walking from Rockefeller Center (51th) to the hotel without tiring. That's why I say the perfect location of Hotel. Security: In Manhattan, security is very high. Do not you feel insecure any second. Cops on every street. You can walk to Metro and walking in safe in Manhattan any time. I do not guarantee outside Manhattan, like the Bronx, Harlem, Queens. In Manhattan, you're protected 24 hours a day. Taxi: There's in front the Hotel. Are $ 50 to go to JFK. Check-In: Really is 16:00. I got the 15:30, but I think that was luck. Check-Out is 11:00. Breakfest: My reservation, had not included the breakfast. The cost is $ 15 per person. In region of the Hotel, there are many options for taking a breakfest, good, and priced well over down if you compare with the Hotel. It has all the Fast Foods at the corner of 5th. Avenue. Delhi's had a lot too. And have the Speed's Deli, on corner from the hotel, which serves Breackfest, Lunch and Dinner. Food very good and cheap. Information: In this Hotel,have a lot of airline crews. I saw KLM, Swiss, and others. I saw too, a large groups of Brazilians. It's very commom big brazilian groups. I'm talking of groups of 20 or 30 people. These groups arrive and depart daily. If you have the misfortune to find them during check-in can cause problems, and consider some delay to ckeck-in or another question. I recommend this hotel to everyone. I hope this review helps someone. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “We Lucked Out”
Reviews.Author: Davesito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located around the block from the Empire States Building and within walking distance to Macy's, Times Square and other attractions. An entrance to the subway is literally right outside the door - right outside! There are hundreds of restaurants and shopping all over the place. It's not right in the middle of the Times Square actions, but Times Square is only two subway stops away and a relatively short walk. I was most impressed with the room. It was a very large room for Manhattan. It was clean. All you really care about in Manhattan is a clean, quiet room because you intend to spend most of your time out and about. I plan on staying at this hotel whenever I come back.

Reviews.Title: “New York , New York”
Reviews.Author: crunch2308
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the Empire State building and also the Metro system. Easy to get around from the hotel all the tourist areas eaily accessed from the area and Macys a 2 min walk for all that important shopping Hotel clean and tidy rooms like most New York hotels of an adequte size ideal for the sight seeing but quite noisey due to its central location Recepti,on staff did their job but didnt put themselves out when we arrived e.g. when we booked in staff provided us with keys and no friendly greeting or directions as to where to find lifts etc very unusual for the US where service with a smile is the norm . Perhaps the management need to do some customer service training as the front desk is your first experience of this hotel. Bell boys etc were the opposite very helpful and friendly I would receommend this hotel to anyone including family as the hotel is good value for money but would warn them that reception is not a good first impression

Reviews.Title: “As the real estae agents would say Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: dotanddave
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with nearly eveyone, the staff are so off, we took the attitude that it was better than the other place we had been stopping at in NY and we tried not to care about the ignorant staff. We are going to stay there again later this year and again will ignore the rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines weekend break”
Reviews.Author: slefley
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely and in a fantastic location for exploring New York, but the rooms were extremely tired (and small) with limited facilities for the price... and that was with a free upgrade to a junior suite! The attached diner served great food and the staff were very friendly. The view was a bit disappointing (from our room at least)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: wonderwoman
Reviews.Content: I really couldn't tell you what amenities were offered at this hotel because I was out exploring during the day and only returned to my room to freshen up for dinner and of course, sleep. My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at this hotel and we had no problems at all. Of course, we LOVED the location. We took the subways everywhere...and the hotel is within walking distance to Macy's and Times Square. Rooms were clean and smelled a little musty...but that was only noticeable the first day. We booked the room on hotels.com for about $160/night. Excellent price for this location!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel amazing but customer service was extremely poor!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayKing18
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went to this hotel which is perfect for the location, When we arrived our room was not ready, however to apologise the hotel gave us several vouchers for free drinks at the bar. On our last day we asked someone at reception to phone the taxi company and confirm it to pick us up at 10 am and was told to do it ourselves.
